Yolanda has been a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC for10 years and requests a loan to pay for a medical check-up and purchase medicine.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase medicine.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 78 years old, a widow, and lives in San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC and has enjoyed its services, especially when she needs money for her medications. 

Recently she availed another loan of PHP 40,000 to pay for her medical check up and the purchase of maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for her medical check up and the purchase of maintenance medicines

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a hardworking farmer. She tills her own farm and nurtures it so that it can give her a good harvest. Elenita is 42 years old, married, and lives in Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. 

She believes that through her farming activity she can alleviate the financial condition of her family. The continued financial assitance extended by Paglaum MPC to her also helps. 

This cropping period, she avails a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

location.town: Sindangan - Disud, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Teothelma

texts.en:
Teothelma is 55 years old, married, and lives at Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has a vegetable farm that she has cultivated for 25 years. She signed up for membership in Paglaum MPC and avails its various services and programs. 

Recently, she asked for PHP 14,000 to purchase eight bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase eight bags of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old, married, and lives in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She and her husband have been farmers together for almost 20 years. She is grateful for the financial assistance extended by Paglaum MPC because she was able to finance her farming activity. 

Recently, she asked for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Nitcer

texts.en:
Nitcer is 42 years old, married, and from Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle repair shop just outside his house. He is one of the members in good standing with Paglaum MPC and has repaid all his loans without records of default. 

Recently, he availed another loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle repair shop business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle repair shop business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Efrenia

texts.en:
Efrenia is 40 years old and from Alegria, Cebu. She is married with three children. Her eldest is 18 and her youngest is 12.  It has been 15 years since Efrenia started her hog raising business that allows her to earn an income of PHP 7,000 per month. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed to keep them healthy and disease-free.

Like most mothers, she is willing to do everything so that her children can graduate from college and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a 44-year-old married woman from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She has five children, and the oldest child is 17 years old while the youngest child is 10 years old. 

Jesusa and her husband have been in a fishing business for 20 years. She is asking a loan of PHP 11,000 to pay for boat repair. Once it can be fixed, she can continue business as usual to provide for her family. 

In the future, Jesusa plans to buy an additional boat to have a better income.

loans.use: to pay for boat repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rings, bracelets, necklaces and earrings made from silver

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and from Dumanjug, Cebu. She is married with eight children. Five of them are still dependents, ages 3-15. Her husband is a bus driver while Josephine is raising hogs to help him augment the income of their family. This has been her business for ten years now. 

Josephine is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy piglets, feed and to pay tuition fees. It is her dream to see her children becoming professionals.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and for tuition fees

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 61 years old, married and a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is a barangay official on their barangay (village). 

Recently, he was stricken by a disease, requiring him to avail a loan from the cooperative intended for barangay officials like him. The amount that he borrowed is intended to pay for a medical check up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es:
Noel es un productor de café de 53 años de edad. Vive con su esposa en una alejada comunidad rural en la zona norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con una finca de 4 manzanas, de las cuales 3 aproximadamente son de café, principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. En los últimos 20 años, Noel ha estado dedicado a esta actividad, tiempo en el cual se ha integrado al proceso de certificación Fairtrade a través la asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria, y obtenido varios préstamos de esta organización. 

Los rendimientos productivos de café en ese período (2011-2015), por parte de este emprendedor, han sido de 90 quintales de café pergamino. Para este ciclo 2015-2016, su objetivo es incrementar la productividad de su cafetal y obtener más de 100 qq de café pergamino, dándole un manejo adecuado a su plantación y mejorando las aplicaciones de fertilizantes con las dosis completas para que las plantas puedan asimilar y dar mejores resultados. Para esto, este emprendedor está solicitando un crédito que le permita garantizar la compra de fertilizantes para su plantación de café. Su pasión por el trabajo y por salir adelante con sus hijos, es algo que siempre ha caracterizado a Noel, y le ayudará a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Noel is a coffee farmer and is 53 years old. He lives with his wife in a remote rural community in the northern region of Nicaragua. He relies on a farm of 6.96 acres, of which approximately 5.22 acres are coffee, which is his main source of income for his family. In the last 20 years, Noel has been making a living through this activity, time in which he has become part of the certification Fairtrade through the association Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria. He has obtained various loans from this organization.

Coffee yields during that period (2011 - 2015), due to this entrepreneur, has been 90 quintales of pergamino coffee. For this cycle (2015 - 2016), his objective is to increase the yields of his coffee farm and obtain more than 100 quintales of pergamino coffee. This would give him adequate management over his plantation and improve the application of fertilizers with the complete doses so that the plants can absorb and give better results. For this, this entrepreneur is requesting a loan which will enable him to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation. His passion for his work and to get ahead with his children, is something that has always characterized Noel and will help him achieve his objective.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers which he will apply on his coffee farm to improve the productivity of his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina is from Alegria, Cebu. She is married with two adult children. She assist her husband in his farming by also engaging in a hog raising business. This has been her business for 20 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy feed and piglets to raise. 

Avelina is more excited to look after her hogs when her stock of feed is sufficient. This way, she will not buy on a per kilo basis, which is more expensive and she can just focus on managing her business well so that she can grow quality hogs that are easy to market and will give her a higher return of investment.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two piglets and one sack of feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, salt, shampoo and detergent

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus hijos en su pequeña finca de 9 manzanas, de las cuales 3 son de café los cuales produce bajo los criterios de certificación Fairtrade. 

En los últimos años, este productor ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 102 quintales de café pergamino, lo cual para este año ha tomado como un reto, proponiéndose incrementar este rendimiento productivo y alcanzar una cosecha de al menos 120 quintales. Para esto, Pedro está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, lo cual contribuirá a asegurar la demanda nutricional de su plantación. Esta inversión se sumará al esfuerzo y trabajo que él y su familia vienen realizando en su finca para alcanzar mayores resultados y de esa forma mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Pedro is a coffee producer in the northern region of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and children in their small farm of 15.66 acres, of which 5.22 are coffee which he produces under the criteria of Fairtrade certification.

In the last few years, this producer has achieved a harvest of approximately 102 quintals of pergamino coffee. This year he has taken a goal, deciding to increase this productive return and reach a harvest of at least 120 quintals. For this, Pedro is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy inputs and fertilizers which will contribute to meeting the nutritional demand of his farm. This investment will add to the effort and work that him and his family have been making in their farm to achieve better results and thus improve their economic status.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizers that his coffee farm requires.

loans.name: Atipay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sara Rossana,la socia sigue con su negocio de venta de pinturas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua vendiendo sus pinturas a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas entre otros.
  Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de calzados, negocio de venta de libros, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y se comprometen para el próximo desembolso estar todos.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The group members are part of the communal bank "Atipay". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Sara Rossana. She continues operating her business selling paints. The member is a responsible and diligent person. The member appreciates all those who are part of her dream through this means, and she agrees to comply with the payment of her quotas in the established time period. The member continues selling her paints to her customers who request it, this being the way the member is able to help her family get ahead.

The member is requesting a loan to buy paints among other things.

The other members work in the business of selling shoes, selling books, owning a grocery store, and selling food. The members who appear in the photo attached asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work reasons and promise to all be present for the next payment. The person who appears with her face covered is not a member of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy paints among other things.

loans.name: Hatun Rumiyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal HATUN RUMIYOC, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Melina sigue con su negocio de venta de cosméticos como cremas, perfumes, colonias entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de colonias entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los demás socios se dedican a la venta de artesanía, producción de zapatos, periodista, contadora, elaboración de tortas.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank Hatun Rumiyoc. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco. The member, Melina, continues her business selling cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, colognes, among other things. The member is a responsible and diligent person. The member appreciates the awarded loan and is committed to comply with her established quotas. The member continues selling to her customers which request her. The member wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member requests a loan to buy colognes among other things.

The members which appear in the attached photos asked for permission to arrive late to the meeting due to work reasons. The other members make a living selling handicrafts, making shoes, as a journalist, as an accountant, and making cakes.

loans.use: to buy colognes among other things.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is from Alegria, Cebu. He is 43 years old. He has two children, ages 9 and 17. For 15 years now, he has been operating a sari-sari (general) store business in his home. He also owned a pharmacy and an Internet cafe. 

Vicente's hard work also includes raising hogs for additional income. He is asking for a loan to buy feed to fatten them. With his multiple businesses, he dreams of making expansions and making it more sustainable for his children's future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Chimpahuaylla Group

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA, el banco es ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Estefanía  continua con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo  arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican al reciclaje, venta de leña, brindado el servicio de taxi, venta de emolientes, crianza de gallinas.
texts.en:
The member is part of the communal bank Señor de Qoyllority de Chimpahuaylla. The bank is located in the department of Cusco. 

The member, Estefanía, continues her grocery store business. The member appreciates the loan awarded and is committed to comply with her established fees. The member is a responsible and diligent person. The member continues selling rice, sugar, milk, among other things. The member wishes to continue working in order to help support her family.

The member requests a loan to buy rice, oil, among other things.

The other members make a living through recycling, selling firewood, providing a taxi service, selling emollients, and raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, among other things.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is an individual client aged 40. He is a mixed farmer but mainly grows vegetables because of their high demand on the market. He also trades vegetables and has a stall in the market center. 

He has been in this business for fifteen years. Sometimes though the weather changes do not favour him; his vegetables at times dry up and also choke on the sun or pests. 

He will use the loan to buy herbicides as well as fertilizers to improve his productivity. He also wants to buy dry grass to mulch his tomatoes. His other challenge in his business is the high demand that is more than his production and the supplies he has.

loans.use: To boost his vegetable growing by buying farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skim milk for making ice cream

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia lives in the municipality of Alegria, Cebu. She is married with three children, ages 12, 14 and 15. Cecilia is engaged in selling Avon products like cologne, hand and body lotion, lingerie, body wash and cosmetics. From this business she earns PHP 3,000 per month. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock of lotion, lipstick, tanks and tops. In the future, she plans to increase her inventory of items and expand her business for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy stock of lotion, lipstick, tanks and tops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and coconut

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shirts

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en:
Adrine is a 39-year-old woman. She has always lived on a farm, and she has a lot of experience in livestock and agriculture. Adrine lives with her husband and 5 children, who are 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 years old. Adrine says that all of her children are studying and that it is very hard to pay for the education expenses for all of them.

Adrine has demonstrated that she is a very responsible woman in her business and with her family. For this reason, the money she requests is to buy a cow to milk; by selling the milk, she will have the income she needs to pay for her children’s education.

Adrine lives with her family in a small house but she and husband are working hard to build a better one in the near future. Adrine wants her business to continue going forward, so that her children can obtain good quality education. She is hard working and focused.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 37 years old from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with children who are still studying in school. 

Emelita is dependent on the income that she is getting from farming rice. It is very hard work to be working in the field but like most parents, she is willing to do everything so that her children's life will be better. 

She is asking for a loan to sustain her business for her children's future. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to grow her crops. In the future, she hopes to see all her children become successful and professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a 42-year-old married woman from Badian, Cebu. She sells fish in the wet market to earn a living. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more stocks of fish, shrimps and squid. Margarita hope to improve her sales and find other business opportunities in the future. Her income will pay for food, allow her to save and she will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, shrimps and squid.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase piglets.

loans.name: Roza

texts.en:
This is Roza, a 52-year-old villager and a married mother of three who is seeking your financial help to buy two dairy cows. She has been doing a livestock business for almost 20 years, and this has been the only source of income for the entire family, with no other extras. 

Currently, Roza has one dairy cow from which she sells approximately 14 liters of raw milk a day for about nine months a year, and she also sells a baby calf a year. She also has three sows and sells 16 piglets a year. In addition to livestock, she’s got some orchards, grapevines and agricultural land where she plants mainly corn, wheat and fodder, and sells part of these products.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows as rural activity is the only source of income for her family

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is very thankful to Kiva for granting her a loan amounting to PHP 100,000, which she used to buy sacks of rice, sacks of sugar, coffee, and diapers for a second mini-grocery she planned to set up near her first store. Her new store is doing well, as it now gaining a steady income with regular customers. Maricel was able to pay her loan and hire another helper to operate her store, as she manages her other store. 

Maricel had a plan of renovating her store to add some shelves to place her stock and buy more stock as the store expanded.

Maricel is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP 100,000 to pay for the store renovation and buy additional stock of rice, coffee, laundry soaps and other items to sell to her store. 

Maricel is confident that with the new loan, she will be able to increase her income more as she continues to help her community by employment and providing a better future for her children.

loans.use: to pay for the store renovation and buy additional stock of rice, coffee, laundry soaps and other items to sell to her store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is very thankful to Kiva for the loan granted to her in the amount of PHP 25,000, which she used to buy one sack of flour, 10 kilos of sugar, 10 trays of eggs for rice cake making added to her breakfast and noodles, and 10 kilos of fresh fish for dressing. Lucila's business is doing well, as she was able to pay her loan on time; also the revenue of her income helps a lot with their daily expenses and her maintenance medicine for her hypertension.

Lucila is now requesting another loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy one box of noodles, spices and other ingredients for hot noodle soup (mami), and one sack of flour, sugar and eggs for rice cake making.

The additional capital will help her to continuously support her business, as more customers demand noodles and rice cake this rainy season. She wanted to grab the chance to increase her income to provide for her basic needs.

loans.use: To buy one box of noodles, spices and other ingredients for hot noodle soup (mami), and one sack of rice, sugar and eggs for rice cake making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a precision seed-drill

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
This is Rina with her adorable 6-year-old son. She is 31 years old and a married mother of three, ages 8, 6 and 3, and they live in the rural northern part of Albania. The loan she is requesting will be used to build some concrete pillars around the yards, the house and the agricultural land; this will be sort of a fence. 

Rina has been pursuing rural activities for about 10 years; she plants mainly wheat, and she rents out the rest of the land she owns. In addition to this, she plants veggies for the family and has 13 flocks.  

Rina’s husband is disabled and receives a disability income of $99/month, and she works as a kitchen helper for a pay of $250/month, as well.

loans.use: to build concrete pillars around the yard and her agricultural land

loans.name: Angelica's Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (ANGELICA, ESMY YADIRA, MARISOL)  que se organizaron hace 12 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos. Con los 2 créditos financiados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le han permitido incrementar sus inventarios para sus pequeñas pulperías.

ESMY YADIRA: Es integrante del grupo solidario Shes, es una mujer sonriente de 26 años, pertenece a la etnia miskita, vive en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su esposo trabaja como enfermero, tiene un pequeño hijo de 6 años que estudia su segundo grado de primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 02 años estableció una pequeña pulpería. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar: Granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking women (Angelica, Esmy Yadira, and Marisol) who organized 12 months ago. Their goal is to access financing for their small businesses, increase their incomes, improve their living conditions, pay for necessities for their households, and ensure educations for their children. With the two prior loans that they received from Pana Pana, they increased the inventory in their small grocery stores.

Esmy Yadira is a member of the Shes credit group. She is a happy, 26-year-old woman who is a member of the Miskita ethnic group. She lives in Bilwi in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. Her husband works as a nurse and they have a young, 6-year-old son who is in his second year of primary school.

In order to have her own source of income and contribute to the household and to her children's education, she started a small grocery store two years ago. She is requesting a loan to purchase staple grains, sweets, and other products. She dreams of becoming a successful merchant.

loans.use: to purchase staple grains, sweets, and other products.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a 26-year-old married woman from Dier Al-Balah.  She lives with her husband and their three children in a humble, old house.  Her husband works in the public sector and is barely able to cover his family's needs.  Hanan decided to help her husband and took a loan from FATEN to open a salon in the house and to buy the necessary tools.  Hanan dreams of expanding her salon in the future and improving conditions for her family.  (She appears in the photo.)

loans.use: to open a salon in the house and to buy the necessary tools.

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr: Lassine est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Samale au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 59 ans, Lassine est le père de 6 enfants âgés de 36 à 04 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture ont incité Lassine à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs, le riz, et le maraîchage sur sa parcelle de 4 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour la culture du maïs disait-il:( je n'ai pas l'argent en liquide pour acheter le semoir et c'est pour cette raison que je veux le semoir en prêt.) L’accès au semoir lui permettra La rapidité et la reussite dans le travail. Lassine espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants  et assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Lassine is a myAgro farmer who lives and works in the village of Samale to the south-west of Bamako in Mali. Lassine is a 59-year-old father to six children aged between four and 36 years old; five of them are currently receiving an education. Farming allows him to ensure his family's independence, but it also a family tradition. It is his household's principal source of income and food sufficiency. All these factors, as well as a love for the profession, led Lassine to become a farmer. He cultivates maize, rice and vegetables on his four-hectare plot of land. As a farmer, he has to face many difficulties, such as a lack of rain and a lack of farming equipment, as well as a lack of quality fertilizer.

This year, he wanted to purchase a seed-drill for growing maize. He doesn't have enough cash to purchase one, which is why he wants this loan. Access to a seed-drill will allow him to quickly and efficiently carry out his work. Lassine hopes that with the increase in his crop yield and his revenue, he will be able to pay for his children's school fees and ensure his family is well fed.

loans.use: to purchase a precision seed-drill

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 19-year-old single man from Khanyounis, which is both a city and a refugee camp in the Gaza Strip where unemployment is very high.  He has been transporting goods using his rickshaw.  Yousef buys products wholesale and resells them for a small profit margin.  Yousef has taken out a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more products to resell. 

Yousef has a small business buying products wholesale and reselling them for a small profit margin.  As part of this business, he must buy items in bulk (large quantities) and deliver them to his customers using his personal vehicle.  Yousef’s loan will enable him to buy more inventory to resell and to eventually increase the size of his business and his income.

loans.use: to buy more products to resell.

loans.name: Amaal

texts.en:
Amaal is a 54-year-old married woman from Khanyounis, which is both a city and a refugee camp in the Gaza Strip where unemployment is very high.  She has been selling goods in her small retail shop.  Amaal buys and sells the products for a small profit margin.  She has taken out a loan from FATEN that will help her buy more products to resell.

Amaal’s loan will enable her to buy more inventory and goods to resell and to eventually increase the size of her business and her income.  (She appears in the photo.)

loans.use: to buy more items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Los Jazmines Group

texts.es: Este grupo está emprendiendo su segundo ciclo. La mayoría de los socios se conocen entre sí y son responsables. Mirsa es una señorita de  21 años de edad, es una de las socias del Grupo “Los Jazmines”. Hace tres  años ella implemento una pequeña bodega en su casa de sus padres para poder apoyar a su mama y afrontar  los gastos de sus estudios ya que esta en los últimos ciclos de sus estudios de contabilidad . Una de sus metas de Mirsa es poder culminar sus estudios superiores y poder ejercer su profesión. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería de abarrotes para su bodega. Mirsa es la persona que esta parada en el segundo lugar del lado derecho de la foto. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por confiar en ellos.
texts.en:
This group is beginning its second loan. The majority of the members know each other and are responsible. 

Mirsa is a 21-year-old woman and is a member of the "Los Jazmines" group. Three years ago, she started a small store in her parents' home so that she could support her mother and pay for her education expenses. She is close to completing her accounting degree. One of Mirsa's goals is to complete her advanced studies and work in her profession. She will invest the loan by purchasing merchandise for her general store.

Mirsa is the person standing on the second from the right in the photograph. The group thanks Kiva lenders for having confidence in them.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Los Angeles” está conformado por seis personas responsables con distintas actividades comerciales una de ellas es la Sra. Mili de 28 años, conviviente con una hija que está en secundaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y gaseosas en un triciclo de manera ambulatoria.Desde muy pequeña a Mili le gusta el negocio ya que creció en contorno del negocio de su madre. Con los ingresos de sus ventas Mili apoya a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar. El mayor anhelo de Mili es construir su casa para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia. Solicito el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas e insumos(azúcar, canela,etc.) para la preparación de sus refrescos. Mily es la persona que viste bividí color negro.
Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "Los Angeles" group is made up of six responsible people with different jobs. One of the women is Mili, who is 28 years old, and married with a daughter who attends secondary school. She makes a living by selling beverages and soft drinks out of a tricycle. Mili's mother had a similar business, so Mili has enjoyed the business from a young age. With her income, Mili helps her husband to pay for household expenses.

Mili's greatest dream is to build a house so that her family can be more comfortable. She requests this loan to purchase soft drinks and supplies (sugar, cinnamon, etc.) to prepare her drinks. Mili is the woman wearing the black sleeveless shirt in the photo. She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and supplies.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Alma has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 60-year-old widowed woman with nine children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Angela has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 46 yaers. Angela requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and married with two children.

Angelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Angelita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 55 years old and married.

She earns a living with a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Conchita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Conchita has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Elenita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elenita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Elenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 23-year-old single man from Khanyounis, which is both a city and a refugee camp in the Gaza Strip where unemployment is very high.  He has been fishing in his small boat.  Nidal has taken out a loan from FATEN that will help him buy a fishing net and maintain his boat.

Nidal’s loan will enable him to buy a new fishing net and to increase the size of his business and his income.  He appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and to maintain his boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tools for car maintenance.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 53 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Emelia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Emelia has been raising livestock for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional variety of fish to sell for her fish vending business. Josefina has been in this business for 8 years. Josefina earns more income from food vending.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her business.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Grecilla

texts.en:
Grecilla is 50 years old and married. She has five children, two of whom are in school.

Grecilla is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Grecilla requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Grecilla has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Grecilla would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 29 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living with a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Janeth is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase piglets, feed, etc., for her business.

Janeth has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Wende Lasida Group

texts.fr: Rasmata est une femme qui à 37 ans,elle mère de 2 enfants. Elle dans la coiffure il y a plus 14 ans. Son atout et sa force est l'expérience quelle à dans le métier. Elle maîtrise son activité;de plus est au bords d'un carrefour et d'un marché;elle travail de puis 2 ans avec ACFIME et à toujours respecté ses engagements. Elle prends le crédit pour acheter des mèches, des fille et des tissage.
texts.en: Rasmata is a 37-year-old married mother to two children. She started hairdressing over 14 years old. The main advantage she possesses is the amount of experience she has gained in this trade. She has mastered all aspects of her work. Also, her premises are located at a crossroads near a market. She has been working with ACFIME for over two years and has always respected her responsibilities. She is taking out this loan to purchase weaves and hair extensions. She also wants to hire girls to help run her salon.

loans.use: to purchase 50 packs of hair extensions and 40 packs of weaves

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 34 years old and married with one child.

Jovelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jovelyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending and electronic mobile load retailing.

Jovelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 39 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Marichu works very hard to provide for them.

Marichu runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Marichu has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, soft-drinks, coffee, etc.

In the future, Marichu would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Anju is 47 years old. She is married and has two children. Many years ago, she established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy pesticides and seeds. 

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarkari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en: Sushila is 42 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 11. Many years ago she established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already established a good business and wants a loan from Patan BPW to buy grain and chicks for her business. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley. In the future,She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy grain and chicks

loans.name: Bhawani

texts.en:
Bhawani is 42 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 23 and 19. 

In 2000, Bhawani established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and hour hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid a previous loan from Patan BPW. 

She used this recent loan to purchase hay and medicines. 

In the future, Bhawani plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy food for cattle, like hay, and medicines

loans.name: Krishna Maya

texts.en:
Krishna Maya is 35 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 12.

Many years ago, Krishna Maya established her cow-raising business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy a young, milk-giving cow.

In the future, Krishna Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.

loans.use: to purchase food for cattle like hay, grass.

loans.name: Devaki

texts.en:
Devaki is 48 years old. She is married and has one child, age 23.

Many years ago, Devaki established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.

Devaki has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy pesticides and seeds.

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarkari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Sukumaya

texts.en:
Sukumaya is 32 years old. She is married and has two children ages 12 and 8. In 2008 she established her handicraft business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She takes loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy bamboo for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Devi

texts.en:
Devi is 45 years old. She is married and has two children. Many years ago, she established her business growing and selling produce and vegetables. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy pesticides and seeds. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Aurelia works hard to support her family. She has a business raising pigs, in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Aurelia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Aurelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is 50 years old. She is married and has three sons. Many years ago she established a vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her business.

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Busoliha

texts.ru:
Бусолиха позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. С детства Бусолиха мечтала стать учительницей, но так сложились обстоятельства, что она не смогла получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Сразу после окончания средней школы Бусолиху выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,   никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Бусолиха вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Бусолиха выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Бусолиха получает хороший доход. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Бусолиха с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Бусолиха заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Busoliha is an optimistic and hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. She works in a small village. Since childhood she dreamed of becoming a teacher, but the circumstances were such that, due to her family’s financial insecurity, she could not attend college. Right after finishing secondary school Busoliha was married off. This is how she became a homemaker. But even  though staying at home she is never idle. She and her husband do all they can to provide their children with all necessities. 

In order to have a reliable source of income, Busoliha and her husband launched their own business. They raise livestock. Busoliha  raises cattle and then sells meat and milk. She obtains a decent revenue, but at present she and her husband do not have sufficient means to cover all their needs. At present they would like to bus several more heads of cattle for fattening. This is why Busoliha has applied to Arvand and would like to take out a loan to buy cattle. Busoliha thanks Arvand in advance for its support, which will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy  cattle.

loans.name: Bipana

texts.en:
Bipana is 34 years old, married, and has two children. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

Bipana requested her eighth loans from Patan BPW, which she will use to buy calf to add to her income source. In the future, she plans to improve the economic condition of her family. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to purchase a small calf

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a business in the Philippines, direct selling Avon products. Imelda requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers. Imelda has been in this business for eight years now.

Imelda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mohan Maya

texts.en:
Mohan Maya is 40 years old. She is married and has two children, one son and a daughter. She started to weave carpets from an early age and is supporting her family with this service.

She has taken many loans from BPW and successfully paid back all. With this recent loan, she is applying for buying wool and thread for weaving carpets.

She is working hard, 8 hours a day and 7 days a week, to improve her financial status to give her family life a better life.

loans.use: to buy raw thread and wool for carpet weaving.

loans.name: Mishri

texts.en:

She has already received and successfully repaid 7 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy feed and medicine for cows. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarkari) are the staples of the Nepali diet, and farmers can also sell cow milk. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy food  and medicine for cattle

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Jamuna is 39 years old. She is married and has four children aged 23, 20, 18, and 8. Many years ago, she established her meat shop business. Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.

She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy chickens for her shop.

In the future, Jamuna plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 48 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Marivic is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Marivic has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from general store.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Marites has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising livestock and food vending. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer con 48 años de edad, dedicada a la preparación y posteriormente venta de comida, un negocio que monto en su propia casa y del cual ha logrado un gran progreso tanto como familia y empresaria.

Solicita de un auxilio económico el cual lo invertirá en un surtido general de alimentos y en la compra de una estufa industrial, la cual le permitirá más agilidad para la preparación de estos.
Desea que sus clientes la busquen por calidad, economía y buen servicio.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero como madre su mayor anhelo es poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos, pues su futuro le preocupa.
texts.en:
Teresa, 48, owns a business making and selling prepared food.  She operates the business from her house and credits it both with supporting her efforts to help her family and establishing herself as a successful entrepreneur.  

Teresa is applying for a loan that she will use to buy an industrial oven and the basic supplies she needs to carry on her business.  The oven will allow her to make a wider range of food to sell.  Her customers, she says, want quality and good service, at a fair price.  

Teresa has many dreams, but her greatest hope is that she can pay for her children's schooling so that they can have better futures.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and basic supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en: Rachana is 39 years old and is from Chapagaun. She is married and has 3 children including one son and two daughters aged 19, 21 and 16 respectively. She has opened a small business, a retail shop for textiles. She has used BPW loans for many years and she has continued with a recent loan of 40000 NPR to buy stock of threads and other necessary material for tailoring clothes in her shop. She expects to make more profit providing good service to her clients and improve her life status with financial freedom gradually.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her shop

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 7 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 36 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Mary Jane is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Mary Jane has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 10 years now.

Milagros has requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor un hombre con 44 años de edad, que desde hace poco inicio con su propio negocio, un taller de mecánica, el cual le genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, pues en su barrio siempre lo buscan por calidad, economía y buen servicio.
Actualmente tiene un problema, su negocio está ubicado en un lugar donde no hay techo y últimamente las lluvias impiden que este hombre pueda trabajar, es por esto que solicita un  préstamo, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de este.

En sus manos esta que este hombre pueda seguir adelante con su negocio, anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 44-year-old man who started his own mechanic workshop business a short time ago. With his business he earns the income necessary to cover the expenses his household deserves. He works every day for 8 hours a day. His business has seen good progress, as people in his neighborhood always seek him out for his quality, economy and good service.

Currently he has a problem: his business is located in a space where there is no roof, and lately the rains have prevented him from working. For this reason he is asking for a loan that he will invest in buying a roof. 

It's in your hands to ensure that this man will be able to get ahead with his business; take action and give a loan.

loans.use: to buy a roof for his business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena, 31 years old and married, has been raising livestock in the Philippines for three years now. Her five previous loans from NWTF repaid, she has requested a new one for PHP 15000 to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Nena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Princess Adelyn

texts.en:
Princess Adelyn is 24 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Princess Adelyn has been operating a general store in the Philippines for five years now, selling a variety of items such as rice, feeds, canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers, sanitary pads, etc. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more such items.

Princess Adelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as rice, feeds, canned goods, soft-drinks, diapers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Uaminifu Group

texts.en:
Uaminifu Group is from Wezesha Project from Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. Apendeki (center) is a member of this group and she is a married mother of eight children. Currently her husband is unemployed. 

Apendeki sells fresh fish and requested a new loan because she found the last loan really helped increase her income. Wit the profits from her next loan she will to better provide a quality life for her children. Apendeki is a good businesswoman and she has regular clients.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 54 years old and she lives in the frontier village Gosh of Tavusg region. Hasmik lives here with her daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. Her son is in Russian Federation and doing there constructional work, so he sends money for his family needs in the village.   

Hasmik, with the help of her daughter-in-law, runs a farm and she has cows, calves, pigs, piglets, rabbits and chickens. She also has large plot of land on which she cultivates potatoes, beans, tomato, cucumber and greens. All her farm products Hasmik sells right from her farm during the week. She also sells pork to the city butchers and she seriously thinks of her swine breeding development. 

With this loan she wants to buy a pig and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a pig and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana una señora de 48 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de pollo y huevos, un negocio el cual inicio hace poco y un medio por el cual ha salido adelante con sus hijos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual hará la compra de pollos de engorde y cuido de levante.
Con esto espera crecer más con su negocio, que sus clientes la sigan buscando por su economía, calidad y buen servicio.

Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Sabe que de la mano de los colaboradores y prestadores del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Ana is a 48-year-old woman who makes a living selling chickens and eggs; she started this business a short time ago and by means of the business she has been able to get ahead with her children. She works every day for 8 hours a day. She is asking for a loan that she will use to buy chickens and to care for her brood. She hopes to grow her business with this loan, since her customers seek her out for her economy, quality and good service.

She wants to keep working to achieve her dream of improving her living conditions. She knows that she will achieve this with the help of her collaborators and the lenders from the Kiva portal.

loans.use: to buy chickens for fattening and to care for her brood

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre con 25 años de edad, que desde hace poco logro consolidar su propio negocio, una salsamentaría, de allí es donde se generan los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.

Manuel siente que a su negocio le hace falta algo, pues la mayoría de sus clientes son aficionados al futbol, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar un televisor, el cual le atraiga más gente. Espera que sus ingresos aumenten y de tal manera sus ganancias mejoraran.

Como Manuel, miles de empresarios están esperando su ayuda, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel, 25, recently opened a small deli, a business that is now his main source of income.  He works every day, 8 hours a day.  

Manuel says that he needs something extra for the football fans that make up the majority of his customers and is applying for a loan that he will use to buy a television.  The investment will attract more customers, he says, and increase his business.  

Many entrepreneurs, Manuel included, count on your support.  Please support their efforts with your loans.

loans.use: to buy a television, a tool that will attract more customers to his business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Since childhood, Ernesto experienced doing farm work. He did not get a higher education due to financial constraints. Now, Ernesto is in sixties and still has his eagerness to works in his farm. 

He cultivate 1.5 hectares of his farmland since he got married, and his source of income to make living. At his age, Ernesto wants to have savings for their future of his wife. He knows that getting older has more personal needs. While he can manage his farm which is growing of rice, Ernesto wanted to yield more to have bigger profits too. 

With this, he is asking for a loan of P30,000 to buy herbicides and fertilizers for his farm needs. He hopes to maintain the business and grow his crops well.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers for his farm needs.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 49, is residing in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia and has eight children. To make a living and support her family, she operates a farming business, growing rice for sale. So far, she has been in this career for around thirty year. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 5.00 a day. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorcycle. This loan will allow her to have a personal vehicle so that she can experience a convenient way of traveling. She would like to thank all lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her personal transportation

loans.name: Diego Alberto

texts.es:
Diego es un hombre con 26 años de edad, dedicado a la venta de mercancía, un negocio que logro consolidar desde hace poco y del cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia conformada por tres hijos menores y su actual pareja.

Solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de mercancía como ropa y calzado para todo tipo de personas y con lo demás remodelara su negocio, ya que su estado no es el  mejor.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el mayor es poder tener dinero para pagarles la educación a sus hijos, pues su bienestar es primordial.

Con su apoyo Diego podrá cumplir su sueño, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Diego, 26, started a clothing and footwear business recently.  The business provides an income for supporting his family: his wife and three young children.  

Diego is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to buy merchandise--clothing and shoes--for resale and the rest to make improvements to his store. 

Diego has many dreams, but his greatest hope is to pay for his children's schooling because their well-being is his foremost concern. 

Please help Diego with your loans today.

loans.use: to stock his clothing & footwear business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia, a 49-year-old married mother of two, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for 25 years now. The recipient of three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, she is now requesting a new one for PHP 6000 to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 51 years old and married with two children.  

Reynaldo is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Reynaldo requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his livestock.

Reynaldo has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Reynaldo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise his livestock

loans.name: Sari Rejeki Group

texts.en:
The result from pigs sales of the Sari Rejeki group was very good. In the six months of the loan term, they managed and kept the pigs well, avoided disease and the pigs can grow fat and healthy. The ideal weight was reached. The group made their payments on time and attending by all member. Ni Luh Putu, as the head, was very happy for her own result and also for the success of her group. They are very happy and say thank you to all lenders, Kiva and MUK for the support. 

With full support from her family, Ni Luh Putu decide to continue her loan for increasing her business.  With 9 members, the Sari Rejeki group received their new loan of 27.000.000 IDR. This loans is focused to purchase superior piglets and feed.

With her loan, Ni Luh Putu purchased 2 superior piglets for fattening and the rest for feed. To reduce the cost, Ni Luh Putu combine with mixture feed. She hopes, next 5 months the progress for pig growth will be fast and she can sell at a high price. Her husband help her business by find a traditional feed such as banana leaf, everyday from his garden. With this business, she hopes she can saving and supporting her children education.

loans.use: to purchased 2 superior piglets for fattening and the rest for feed

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 60 years old and married. 
Teodora is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Teodora requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teodora has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Teodora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maria Robira

texts.es:
María es una señora con 52 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, dedicada a realizar labores de campo, una actividad que aprendió empíricamente.
Trabaja todos los días entre 7 y 8 horas.

Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso ya posee cultivos con variedad de frutos, solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de abonos, venenos y con lo demás hará unos arreglos que sus cultivos ameritan.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero el principal es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Con su aporte esta señora podrá cumplir su sueño, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
María, 52, is a modest, hard-working woman.  She makes her living from the land, work that she learned by trial and error.  She works 7 to 8 hours a day, every day.  She grows a variety of fruits and has built a successful business over the years.

María is applying for a loan that she will use to buy the supplies she needs--fertilizers, insecticides, etc.--to carry on her business.  

María has many dreams, but her most important are to pay for her children's schooling and make improvements to her house.

Your support can help María fulfill her dreams.  Please make a loan today.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Ronney De Jesus

texts.es:
Ronney es un señor de 48 años de edad, dedicado a la cría de ganado, un medio por el cual ha logrado crecer como familia y empresario.
Todo su tiempo es disponible para laborar.

Solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en los materiales necesarios para arreglar las cocheras, ya que el estado de estas no es el mejor para criar sus cerdos.

Su deseo es formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselos a sus cinco hijas, ya que estas son su motor para el seguir luchando.

Con su apoyo Ronney invertirá en un buen futuro para su familia, haga un préstamo.
texts.en: Ronney is a 48-year-old man who makes a living by raising pigs. By means of this work he has been able to grow as a family and as a businessman. He is available to work at all times. He is asking for a loan that he will invest in the materials necessary to fix the pig pens, as the condition they are in isn't the best for raising his pigs. His wish is to formalize his business and to leave it to his five daughters in the future, as they are his motivation to keep striving. With your support, Ronney will invest in a good future for his family; please make a loan.

loans.use: to invest in the materials necessary to fix the pig pens

loans.name: Cesar David

texts.es:
El socio Cesar David, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Cesar David sigue con su negocio de imprenta, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de tintas entre otros.
texts.en: Cesar David belongs to the Pachapaccari communal bank located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. Cesar David still has his printing business. He has had his business for quite a while and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He is a responsible and hardworking person, and he wants to keep working so he can keep supporting his family. He feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make his established payments. He is asking for the loan to buy ink, among other items.

loans.use: to buy ink, among other items

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 62 year old, married, and has  four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita has a dried fish business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years. 

Anita requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 27 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Liezel operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for seven years. She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, shampoo, soap, condiments, rice, and other groceries. 

Liezel requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Reyna

texts.en:
Reyna is 41 years old and married with four children.

Reyna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Reyna has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a bakery.

Reyna aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 53 years old with five children. Rosa works very hard to provide for her family.
