Rosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, hopia (pastry), candies, vinegar, soy sauce and other groceries . 
In the future, Rosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es una señora con 68 años de edad, debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda de un familiar o alguien cercano, se dedica a la preparación y posteriormente a la venta de comida, un negocio por el cual ha logrado un gran avance, de allí salen los ingresos suficientes para su sostenimiento.
Trabaja 5 días a la semana durante 4 horas diarias.

Actualmente no cuenta con un buen surtido en su negocio, solicita un crédito con el cual comprara insumos como carne, salsas, desechable como vasos, platos y cucharas y con lo demás le hará un arreglo al fogón donde hace la preparación de estos alimentos.

Su mayor sueño es ver su casa bonita, pues el estado en que se encuentra no es el mejor.

En sus manos esta que esta mujer salga adelante y cumpla su sueño, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Marina, 68, has no family or others nearby that she can count on, so she makes her own way with a business making and selling prepared food.  The business, she says, provides enough income to cover her everyday expenses.  She works 4 hours a day, 5 days a week.

Marina is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy a fire pit for cooking and the rest to buy the supplies she needs--meat, condiments, tableware, etc.--to carry on her business.

Marina would like to make improvements to her house because as pretty as it is, it's not in the best repair.

Marina's hopes are in your hands.  Please help her with your loans.

loans.use: to build a fire pit and buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Pana Yuhpa Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Pana Yuhpa: Es un grupo integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, pertenecen a la etnia miskita del municipio de Waspam. Se organizaron recientemente con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento con garantía solidaria con PANA PANA para mejorar sus pequeños negocio de venta de comida e incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida.

YESENIA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Pana Yupha, que en vocablo miskito significa tres amigas. Tiene 25 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace un año vende de manera ambulante fritos de pollo, vigoron, buñuelos, pan de coco, arroz con leche y de viernes a domingo elabora nacatamales. Está solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: Pollo, aceite, harina, tomate, repollo, filipitas, vinagre, pepino, cebolla, carbón, chicharron, queso, canela, coco, levadura, arroz, leche, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con diversificar su menú y vender sopas.
texts.en: The Solidarity Group Pana Yuhpa: It is a group formed by 3 enterprising women. They belong to the Miskita ethnic group from the municipality of Waspam. Recently, they organized with the purpose of accessing a solidarity warranted loan with PANA PANA in order to improve their small businesses of selling food, and to increase their income and improve their life conditions. Yesenia is the coordinator of the Solidarity Group Pana Yupha, which in Miskito means three girlfriends. She is 25 years old. She is married with three children who go to elementary school. With the purpose of contributing with household expenses and her children's education, she has worked for a year selling as a street vendor, fried chicken, "vigoron" (yuca, pork rind and cabbage salad), fritters, coconut bread, rice pudding. From Fridays to Sundays, she makes "nacatamales" (Nicaraguan tamales). She is requesting her first loan to buy: chicken, oil, flour, tomatoes, cabbage, filipitas (type of bananas), vinegar, cucumbers, onions, charcoal, pork rind, cheese, cinnamon, coconut, yeast, rice, milk, among other products. She dreams of diversifying her menu and selling soups.

loans.use: to buy: chicken, oil, flour, tomatoes, cabbage, "filipitas" (a type of bananas), vinegar, cucumbers, onions, charcoal, pork rind, cheese, cinnamon, coconut, yeast, rice, milk, among other products.

loans.name: Thien's Group

texts.en:
Thien is an ethnic Thai  woman who is married and has a son. The family is living in the Mai Son district, Son La province.
 
Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding and the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She also has to find temporary jobs to get more income for the family and pay her child’s education fees. Her son is studying at a secondary school of security. She wants to invest more in her child’s education but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her son's studies and then he will have a bright future. She will work hard to earn money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in her child’s education

loans.name: May

texts.en: May, 37, lives in a community of Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. She is a fisherwoman who can earn, on average, an income of USD $3 a day. She has been in this career for around 20 years. Her current boat is pretty old and she wants to replace it with a new one but cannot afford it. That is why she is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a new boat.  This loan will make a great contribution to develop her career as well as raise her living standard. She is thankful to all the lenders for their kind financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new boat

loans.name: Cinthya Masina

texts.es:
La socia Cinthya, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia sigue  con su negocio de imprenta, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando trabajos para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes para impresión entre otros.
texts.en: Cinthya belongs to the Pachapaccari communal bank located in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco. She still has her printing business; she has had her business for quite a while and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. She is still doing work for her customers who request her. She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her established payments. She is asking for the loan to buy ink for printing, among other items.

loans.use: to buy ink for printing, among other items

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.es:
El socio Ferdinand, pertenece al banco comunal PACHAPACCARI,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio continua con su negocio de imprenta, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes  para impresión entre otros.
texts.en: Ferdinand, the member, belongs to the PACHAPACCARI Communal Bank, which is located in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. He continues with his printing business. He is a very responsible and hardworking person. He is grateful for the given loan and promises to make his payments on time. He has worked for a long time in this business, which gives him personal satisfaction and a way to move his family forward. He is requesting a loan to buy printing dyes, among other things.

loans.use: to buy printing dyes among other things.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1990 and is a Kinh ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from cultivation of custard apple and longan trees. Each year she can gain VND 40 to 50 million from selling fruit from these trees. Because the newly married couple has just moved to live separately from their parents, they have to pay for so many things. That is why the income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and they have saved a small amount. However, the saved amount is not enough for Huong to buy fertilizer for the custard apple and longan garden. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She hopes the loan amount will help her family tend well the custard apple and longan orchard. Then, the next crop of custard apple and longan will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Cuc, born in 1972, is the Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main income is from the meager civil servant salary of the married couple so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount from the income. 

She wants to repair her house but she does not have enough money to buy materials for it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. 

She hopes that thanks to the loan amount, her family will have good condition to repair the house, make it more spacious and clean, and all members of the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house so as to provide her family with better living conditions

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte _75 Group

texts.es:
ROSSMERY es una mujer de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que se encuentra a 20 kilómetros al este de la ciudad, conocida por la variedad de comida tradicional y por su fiesta patronal donde los creyentes van a pie. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
ROSSMERY es de tez morena, ojos marrones, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (al centro, viste chompa a rayas de colores y buzo negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera, ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento y tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y energía eléctrica, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de moto taxi, venta de carbón, artesanía en cerámica, confección de tejidos, venta de comida, venta de pan y venta de refrescos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano; su jornada comienza muy temprano por la madrugada, para llegar temprano a su puesto de venta antes de que salga el sol, los clientes llegan de ciudades vecinas a comprar por mayor, A las nueve de la mañana  ella y los demás comerciantes deben abandonar las calles para que se abran las galerías comerciales. Cargada de ropa se dirige a su depósito, acomoda y guarda todo, “mi negocio es de forma ambulante, eso me da la oportunidad de visitar a diferentes clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias por mayor, la desventaja es la falta de capital para continuar abasteciendo el negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para vender en temporada de invierno. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 5 años que desarrolla esa actividad.
Es por esos motivos que ROSSMERY solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano abrigada para vender en temporada de invierno y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
ROSSMERY is a 27 year old single woman who has a four year old son. Her business is selling second hand clothing.

She is a good mother, independent, consistent, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the 'Cotoca’ neighborhood which is 20 km east of the city. It is known for it's traditional food and it's Saint's day where the believers travel by foot. It has a subtropical hot climate with a daily temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius.

ROSSMERY is dark skinned, has brown eyes, long black hair that she ties back in a ponytail, is short and of robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní that she speaks in her home and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business. (In the photo she is the center wearing a striped sweater). She shares her life with her partner who works as a builder and her son who is not yet school age. They live in a house that belongs to the family and is built of brick and cement with a metal roof and a cement floor. It has pumped well water and electricity but no sewage.

Her desire to excel led her to form a group with people with businesses like: a motorcycle taxi service, ceramic handicrafts, weaving, selling meals, selling bread and the sales of soft drinks, to request a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is selling second hand clothing. Her day begins very early in the morning so she can get to her sales stand before the sun rises. Her clients come from nearby cities to buy wholesale. At 9 o'clock she and her fellow vendors must leave the streets when the commercial stores open. Loaded down with clothing she heads to her storage, puts it in and locks it. "My business is itinerant, this gives me the chance to visit different clients" she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has daily wholesale sales and her disadvantage is the lack of capital to continue to stock her business.

Her dream is to open a store so she doesn't have to walk around. She wants to purchase second hand clothing to sell wholesale in winter. This is her first loan with the institution in the five years she has done this business. For these reasons Rossmery is requesting a loan warm second hand clothing to sell in winter and continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy warm second hand clothing to sell in winter and continue with her business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 63 years old and has four children. She is married.

Esterlita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Esterlita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 55 years old and married with eight children, four of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita, who has been operating a general store in the Philippines for 10 years now, is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, home care products, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Sinim

texts.en:
Sinim works as a nurse in Vattanak village state hospital. She lives with two children and her farmer husband. As a nurse, she has a busy schedule. Often she needs to take an evening shift, which reduces her time taking care of her little children. She is always concerned about her family's safety when she is not at home, because her family is using car batteries for their power source. The car batteries have an acid substance. Moreover, she has to go out every day to charge the car battery for daily usage. It is a time- and money-consuming activity.

Therefore, Sinim decided to apply for a Kiva loan in order to buy a solar home energy system. While using the solar home system she will be relieved, because she will have no worries about her children's safety. Her children can use the light by themselves, without help from their elders. (The car battery is more difficult, because a person needs to connect the car battery to a lamp whenever they want to turn on the light.) The solar home system will enable her family to live in more convenient conditions, with bright light.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system.

location.town: Vattanak Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Having three children to feed and sending them to school is not easy. Rodrigo is doing his best to provide a better way of living for his family. Rodrigo is a farmer, and at the same time he raises hogs for extra income. His wife is a government employee. His wife's salary serves as their children's allowances while attending their class in school. Meanwhile, his earnings from hog raising serve as their children's tuition fees during enrollment. 

Rodrigo hopes that his children will finish their studies and become professionals someday. He will continue tilling his farm and raising hogs until his children finish their studies. Rodrigo wishes for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to succeed with the business he has, and hopes that his children will succeed as well.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve  is a 23-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school. For three years now, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines.

Having borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her enterprise, Salve is requesting a PHP 15000 loan to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 50 years old with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Ligaya runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of products to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, canned goods, etc.

Ligaya has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of products to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman, who has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Theresa is 45 years old, and her two children are in school.

Theresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to buy fishing nets and other materials that she needs. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Theresa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials that she needs.

loans.name: Yoly

texts.en:
Yoly is a married woman, who has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Yoly is 39 years old, and she has one child still in school.

She has a business, buying and selling soft drinks in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more soft drinks to sell. She has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jenlyn

texts.en:
Jenlyn is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business, buying and selling gasoline, in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell. Jenlyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell gasoline business for three years, and she earns additional income from fishing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Morgana

texts.en:
Morgana is a married woman. She is 56 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Morgana has a business buying and selling movie tapes and DVDs in the Philippines. Morgana requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional movies and tapes to sell.

Morgana has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional movies and tapes to sell

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is a 38-year-old, married woman with four children, who are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur and has a Xerox machine business in the Philippines.  Charita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy needed materials, like bond papers, ink, etc., for her business.

She has been in this business for 7 years.  In the future, Charita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy needed materials, like bond papers, ink, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 44 years old and is married with three children.  She works very hard to provide for her three children, all of whom are in school.

Christine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 5 years.  In the future, Christine would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Erkeaiym

texts.ru: Эркеайым успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по назначению. Эркеайым очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Эркеайым, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец. На 0,64 Га выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход Эркеайым составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего дела, Эркеайым обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с целью откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Эркеайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и покупку легкового автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en: Erkeaiym successfully repaid her loan, which she used for its intended purpose. She is very grateful for Kiva and for everyone who helped finance her. Thanks to her persistent work Erkeaiym currently has two cows and ten sheep on her farm. On her 0.64 hectare plot she grows clover. Her monthly income is 17,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Erkeaiym has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 130,000 KGS to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. Erkeaiym plans to invest the income from her loan in the further expansion of her business and the purchase of a car for the family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 57 years old and married with three children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years, and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

In the future, Luz would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es: Maria vive en casa propia con su madre, su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 4 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house with her mother, her husband, and their two children.  She has had a small store at her house for four years.  She has a lot of customers because of the good prices and the kind way she waits on her customers.

She is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, etc.  This way she will be able to have better earnings in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, and sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Joan works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cultured seaweeds. Joan is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Joan has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 49 years old and has one child still in school.

Salvacion has a recycled materials business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en: Yvonne is 60 years old, married, and has five children.  She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Yvonne requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.  She has been in this business for 29 years now, and she has previously borrowed from NWTF to sustain it once before.  She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 33 years old and is married with two children, who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like condiments, frozen foods, and other groceries.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like condiments, frozen foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Robielyn

texts.en:
Robielyn is 29 years old and married, and she has one child in school. Robielyn works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell, like condiments, home care products, and other groceries. Robielyn has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Robielyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 27 years old and married, and she has two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

Marjorie has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase a stock of household goods to sell. She has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save money, to expand her business, and to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase 200 kilograms of rice.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Estrella works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Estrella is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF. She is using the loan to buy items to sell in her used clothing business, like pants, shirts, etcetera. Estrella has sustained her business activities through one previous loan from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like pants, shirts, etcetera.

loans.name: Yoly

texts.en:
Yoly is a married woman, and she has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has one child still in school.

Yoly has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more fish and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Jenelyn is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF. She is using the loan to buy materials that she needs for her manicure and pedicure business, like nail polish, etcetera.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials that she needs for her manicure and pedicure business, like nail polish, etcetera.

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en:
Rachana is 24 years old from Chapagaun. She is married and has 5 family members including one 8 months daughter child . She is doing small business opening a retail shop of threads. She is using BPW loans for many years and she continues with recent loan of amount 40000 for buying stock of threads and other necessary material for tailoring clothes in her shop. 

She expects to make more profit providing good services to her clients and improve her life status with financial freedom gradually.

loans.use: To buy threads and clothing raw materials

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 45 years-old. She is married and has 2 sons. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: To buy grocery stocks

loans.name: Sabirahan

texts.ru: Сабирахан, 45 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает медицинской сестрой в больнице. Также на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению, Сабирахан успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 25 овец. На 1,40 Га земли она выращивает пшеницу и клевер для реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса и приумножения прибыли Сабирахан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. На доходы от кредита Сабирахан хочет и дальше развивать бизнес и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Sabirahan is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She has a vocational education and works in a hospital as a nurse. In addition, she has been raising livestock and farming for the past 25 years. Thanks to her tireless work Sabirahan has been able to successfully expand her small business. She has four cows and 25 sheep. On 1.4 hectares of land she grows wheat and clover to sell. Her monthly combined income is around 13,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business and increase her profit, Sabirahan is asking Bai-Tushum Bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock for feeding and resale. She wants to use income from use of the loan to further develop her business, and do home repairs.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Dora Lucia

texts.es:
Dora es una señora de 53 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos mayores.
Hace poco inicio con su negocio, un taller de confección a terceros, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su hogar.
Su tiempo de labor es constante, depende de la cantidad de trabajo que tenga.

Actualmente se encuentra con un problema, la falta de una maquina no le ha permitido realizar varios de sus trabajos, solicita un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un maquina de cocer recubridora, con  lo que espera que sus clientes la sigan buscando por calidad y economía.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que su estado no es el mejor, pues con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Dora, age 53, is married and has four grown children.  A little while ago she started her business, making clothes for third parties.  By doing so she has managed to get ahead with her household.

Her work time is steady, depending on the amount of work that she has.

She currently has a problem.  She does not have a machine, and this has kept her from doing various jobs.  She is requesting a loan from the Interactuar Corporation to buy a cover stitch sewing machine.  With the machine she hopes that her customers continue seeking her work because of its quality and good prices.

Her dream is to improve the condition of her house because it is not in the best shape.  In time it has been deteriorating.

loans.use: to buy a cover stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Octavio De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad el señor Octavio, debido a que no cuenta con la ayuda  de un familiar busco los medios y  hace poco logro consolidar su propio negocio, una pequeña tienda, con la cual ha tenida un gran progreso.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas diarias.

Actualmente se encuentra con poco surtido en su negocio, solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas, snack y demás variabilidad de productos del consumo diario.
Con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y de tal forma mejorar sus ganancias.

Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su casa, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.

Aporte al sueño de Octavio, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
At 58 years of age and without the help of any relatives, Señor Octavio sought the means and recently managed to put together his own business. He has made great progress with this business. He works every day for eight hours.

His business currently has low inventory, so he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of drinks, snacks, and a variety of other everyday products. With this, he expects to increase his clientele and thereby improve his earnings.

He wants to continue working in order to realize his dream of improving the condition of his house, as it has been deteriorating with time.

Contribute to Octavio's dream; make a loan.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of drinks, snacks, and a variety of other everyday products.

loans.name: Mary Beck

texts.en:
Mary Beck is 34 years old and married, with three children. One child is still in school. Mary Beck works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Beck runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items of groceries to sell, like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

Mary Beck has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items of groceries to sell, like milk, drinks, coffee, spices, noodles, canned goods, eggs, bread, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Liluz Maria

texts.es:
Liluz es una señora con 45 de edad, que se decida a venderé mercancía desde su casa, un negocio el cual lo inicio por necesidad económica y del que hoy en día se benefician su familia conformada por tres hijos menores y su actual pareja.

Esta señora solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, calzado y accesorios para dama, caballero y niño. Con esto espera que sus clientes aumenten y de tal forma sus ganancias.

Su mayor sueño es seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de comprar una vivienda propia y brindarle a sus hijos mejor calidad de vida.

Sabe que de la mano de los colaboradores del portal Kiva lo lograra.
texts.en:
Liluz, age 45, sells merchandise from her house.  She started the business out of financial necessity.  Now her family, which is comprised of her three minor children and her life partner, is benefiting from the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes, shoes, and accessories for women, men, and children.  By doing so she hopes that her customers will increase, which will increase her earnings.

Her biggest dream is to continue struggling to fulfill the dream of buying her own house and providing her children with a better quality of life.

She knows that with a hand from the Kiva lenders, she will manage to do so.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and accessories for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Mairambu

texts.ru: Майрамбу успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала его по назначению. Майрамбу благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 30 овец. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет 19,600 сом (KGS). Майрамбу вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. В дальнейшем Майрамбу планирует и дальше развивать свой бизнес, чтобы накопить на постройку дома.
texts.en: Mairambu successfully repaid her loan, which she used for its intended purpose. Mairambu is grateful to Kiva and to everyone who helped finance her. On her farm she has five cows and 30 sheep. Her monthly income is 19,600 KGS. Mairambu has once again requested a loan of 150,000 KGS from Bai Tushum Bank for the purchase of three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount. In the future Mairambu plans to further develop her business in order to save up for building a house.

loans.use: to buy three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Bhagwati

texts.en:
Bhagwati is 30 years old. She is married and has one child, age five.

In 2014, Bhagwati established her poultry business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.

Bhagwati has already established a good business and wants a further loan from Patan BPW. Her most recent loan was used to buy small chicks for her business.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open-air markets throughout the valley.

In the future, Bhagwati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy small chicks and grains

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline for her fishing business.

Mylene has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline

loans.name: Lhealyn

texts.en:
Lhealyn is 24 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Lhealyn works very hard to provide for them.

Lhealyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Lhealyn has been in this business for two years.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Lhealyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila is 46 years old and married with three children, one in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Prescila has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Prescila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, coffee, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 70 años de edad, trabajador, humilde y lleno de vida, que a pesar de todos los obstáculos que se le han presentado nunca se ha rendido.
Su trabajo es arreglar relojes, tiene un pequeño negocio el cual logro consolidar desde hace poco, debido a que no cuenta con mucho material para realizar su labor, se encuentra solicitando un préstamo en la Corporación Interactuar con el cual hará la compra de relojes, repuestos, manillas y estuches de controles.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener las comodidades necesarias para su sostenimiento y gozar de una buena salud.
Usted puede hacer parte de este sueño, haga un préstamo e impacte la vida de este hombre.
texts.en:
Luis is a 70 year old man who is hard-working, humble, and full of life. Despite all of the obstacles that he has been presented with, he has never given up.

He works as a watch repairman. He has a small business which he succeeded in establishing not long ago because he does not need a lot of materials to carry out his work. He is requesting a loan from the corporation Interactuar with which he will buy watches, spare parts, watch hands, and toolboxes.

His biggest dream is to be able to have all the necessary amenities to support himself and be in good health. You can be a part of this dream. Give a loan and make an impact on this man's life.

loans.use: to buy watches, spare parts, watch hands, and toolboxes.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. Marife operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Marife requested her fourth loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as sugar, condiments, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. She hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, condiments, eggs, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Sokun is 35 years old, a widowed factory worker with a dependent child and she resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has worked as a factory worker since 2013, making approximately $7 per day. Sokun would like to buy a motorcycle to commute to work, but she doesn’t have enough money, and now she is securing a loan. The loan will enable her to buy a motorcycle and reduce travel expenses. In the future, she wants to save money to run a small tailor shop, and build a new proper house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work

loans.name: Horl

texts.en: Horl, a rubber factory worker and also a farmer, lives in Bos Khnor Village with his wife and three children. Beside his full time work on his company's rubber farm, he has to take care of his own one-hectare rubber farm. To take care of the rubber farm, he needs to get up early and leave a bit late. Currently, he uses a car battery for his business energy; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery runs out during the night. After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor who uses solar home systems, Horl decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system. He believes this decision will improve his energy to run his business and also save on the utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Bos Khnor Village, Kanh Chor Commune, Chhlong Dist

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lydia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling jewelry. Lydia is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Lydia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба жительница района Шахринав. Ей 29 лет, она замужем и очень хорошая мать для своих детей. К тому же Матлюба очень талантливая и целенаправленная женщина. Если она поставит перед собой цель, она всегда добьётся  своего. Идеи для заработка могут быть разными, главное — не только найти занятие по душе, но и стать мастером своего дела. Матлюба зарабатывает шитьем. Она шьет аккуратно, посадку изделия старается доводить до идеальной. Матлюбе необходимо расширит свой бизнес и для этого ей нужно купить новую швейную машинку. К сожалению, у  неё недостаточно средств и она обратилась за кредитом. Матлюбе очень нужна ваше понимание.
texts.en: Matluba is a resident of the Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. She is 29 years old, married, and a wonderful mother to her children. Furthermore, Matluba is a very talented and goal-oriented woman. If she sets a goal for herself, she will always achieve it. Ideas for earning a living may be varied, but the main thing is not only to find something you love doing, but to become a master at it. Matluba earns her living through sewing. She sews carefully and precisely and strives to make the clothing fit perfectly. Matluba must expand her business and for that she needs to buy a new sewing machine. Unfortunately, she does not have enough means and she applied for a loan. Matluba is in need of your understanding.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Felicitas

texts.en:
Ma. Felicitas is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Felicitas is 36 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Felicitas has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more meat to sell.

Ma. Felicitas has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell

loans.name: Revic

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Revic works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Revic is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Revic has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is married and has four children. He is 45 years old and is a farmer. Reynaldo is engage in growing of rice in their field. His wife was his partner in managing their crops. Through their earnings from farming, Reynaldo able to give the basic needs of his family. He has been 35 years in farming and while he can manage it, Reynaldo wishes to maintain it as his family main source of income. 

Reynaldo wants to produce more of his crops to increase his income as well and further sustain his family needs. Hence, he is requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pay for the labor cost in farming. 

Reynaldo hopes to have plenty of harvest by providing enough needs for his crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for the labor cost in farming.

loans.name: N7K2Lsơn- Three Grandmothers Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sâm is 57 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Sâm lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 

The main hardship that Sâm faces is lack of capital.  She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Sâm first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N7K2LSơn- Three grandmothers" group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Sâm hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives with his parents, sister and brother. With all family they have been involved in retail business. They sell clothing, food supplies in nearby villages and communities and gather income for their living. Sargis is responsible for driving the truck and transport the products. He asks this loan hoping for your support. 

Sargis would like to  repair the small truck to take the products to the market and purchase new stock of products (fruits, vegetables, clothing) to sell to customers. Your support is vital for Sargis's and his family's small business and they hope for the support. 

Sargis has now been approved for a loan within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Sargis hopes to receive lenders' support and develop his retail business so his family has better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to the small truck taking products to the market and to purchase new stock of products (fruits, vegetables, clothing) to sell to customers

loans.name: Mama Tuliya Group

texts.en:
Marguerite (second from the left) is a resident of the Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo city of Uvira in the province of South Kivu. She is 33 years old and mother of eight children. 

She will use this new loan to purchase salt fish to resell. She finished her last loan with any problem. From that loan she earned more profit which helped to finish to pay the school fees of her children for the rest of the year. She is a hard working woman she wishes to enlarge her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Usa

texts.en:
Usa and husband work as rubber factory workers lives in Ta Ngoun village with 3 children. Beside working for rubber factory, Usa and husband farm on their 1 hectare cassava farm. 

Usa wants to save utility fee and find a better energy source because her current energy source car battery is not reliable and costly. She needs to recharge battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, Usa decided to apply for Kiva to buy a solar home energy. X believes solar home energy can enhance her living lifestyle in a comfortable condition and save cost.

loans.use: to pay for a solar electricity home system

location.town: Ta Nguon Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Simoun

texts.en:
Simoun, 40, lives in a community of Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. She has four children in total, two are married and two are single. She is a fisherwoman who can earn, on average, an income of USD 5.00 a day. So far, she has been in this career for fifteen years. 

Her current boat is pretty old and she wants to replace a new one but she cannot afford it. That is why she is applying for Kiva loan to buy a new boat.  This loan will make a great contribution to develop her career as well as her living standard. She is thankful for the all lender for their kindly financial support.

loans.use: to buy a new boat for fishing

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Theresa is 52 years old and has one child in school.

Theresa has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Theresa requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Theresa has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Theresa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 42 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Marcela works very hard to provide for them.
Marcela runs a General Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marcela has been in this business for 10 years. 
In the future, Marcela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn works hard to support her family. Emelyn is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.
She requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Emelyn has been in this business for 5 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.
In the future, Emelyn would like to save money to expand her business .

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of pig feeds

loans.name: Josephine Nimfa

texts.en:
Josephine Nimfa is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Josephine Nimfa is 51 years old and has two children who are in school.

Josephine Nimfa has a buy-and-sell beverages business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy soft drinks and other beverages.

Josephine Nimfa has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other beverages.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 40 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jenelyn has been raising pigs for 1 year now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalina  works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell condiments business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Rosalina  is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to  buy more condiments to sell like garlic, onions, etc. for her buy and sell condiments business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more condiments to sell like garlic, onions, etc.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 36 years old, married, and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Amy has been farming vegetables for five years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Amy would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 43 years old and married, with two children. Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like rice, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Rosie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like rice, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: for her husband’s medical treatment

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya with her husband and three children lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She never worked and since getting married till today she is engaged in farming. 

On her farm she has cows, calves, a bull, lambs, sheep and chickens. She sells her farm products at the city wholesale market- she sells milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd, meat and eggs. Sonya makes very tasty cheese but the quantity of her farm milk is not enough to make a lot of cheese both for sale and for her family use. 

So the loan of 500.000 Armenian drams she asks for the purchase of one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Thearom

texts.en:
Thearom is a primary state school teacher living with her husband and two children.

As a teacher, Thearom needs to spend a lot of time at night to prepare her teaching schedule and material. She needs night-time light to prepare her teaching material for use in class. However, her current energy source, a car battery, often runs out without warning, which disrupts her work.

After she found out about the benefits of a solar home energy system, Thearom decided to apply for a Kiva loan. She believes she will have enough energy for her family usage and also to improve her working hours.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Sre Dong village, Thma Andeurk Commune, Chetr Bore

loans.name: Koemneang

texts.en:
Koemneang is a 20-year-old married homemaker with two children in her care, and she resides in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. Her husband is 22 years old and earns some income from construction worker and cooker. Her husband can make a daily income of $6. 

She wants to buy piglets to fatten and sell but she does not have enough money, so she is now requesting a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI. With the loan, she will have enough finances to buy piglets to fatten and earn additional income to improve her living standards. 

In the future, she is going to buy more piglets to fatten, build a proper house and support all her children to earn high education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en: Manizha is a bright girl. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is single and lives with her parents. She is a second year student. She is a responsible, honest and active student. She does home tasks at times. She is well-known among students and friends. She participates at competitions and wins awards within her university. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay her tuition fee. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs.

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa is a 58 years old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows beans,cucumbers,egg plants,tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Temukisa has requested a loan to buy wire,chemicals,seeds,hose etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 20111. With her profits, Temukisa hopes to improve her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy wire, chemicals, seeds, hose,etc.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 55 years old and married, with three children. With two children in school, Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Salvacion has been in this business for three years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Kreng

texts.en:
Kreng is a farmer living with his wife and three children in Damnak Sasar Village. He wants to expand his business with a 7-hectare big cassava farm and would like to make his family living in comfortable conditions. He also wants to save on utility fees.

However, he is facing some problems related to home energy because his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge his car battery every two or three days for daily usage. Sometimes, because he is so busy, he doesn’t have time to charge his battery, and then the whole family is in pitch black darkness for the whole day.

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high quality home solar energy system. He believes that after using solar home energy, his family's living conditions will be better and safer. He will also be able to save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Dieb

texts.en:
Dieb and her husband run a grocery shop and have three dependent children. Their grocery shop has many products; therefore, they need to get up early to prepare their shop before the sun rises.

Currently, they use a car battery to supply energy for their business; however, the car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometimes the car battery's energy runs out during the night time.

After getting a good recommendation from a neighbor who uses a solar home energy system, Dieb decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home energy system. She believes this decision will improve her energy source to run her business and that she will also save on utility fees.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home energy system

location.town: Damnak Sasar Village, Thma Andoeurk Commune, Chetr

loans.name: Khuriyat

texts.en: This is Khuriyat, a single twenty-year-old girl.  A few years ago, she has started to work as a tailor in order to earn a living and improve her tailoring skills. She is talented in tailoring wedding and special occasion dresses and works hard to satisfy her customers’ needs. Through this loan, she intends to develop her business through buying a newly-released tailoring machine which will help her stay financially capable of supporting her beloved parents. Khuriyat has a high hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Ruth Mabel

texts.es: Ruth de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar que está conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos de 22 y 20 años de edad. Ruth es una mujer que cada día se levanta con la esperanza de poder realizar sus labores y de esa manera poder llevar el pan diario a su casa y a sus hijos, sus ingresos dependen de una venta de carne de res y de cerdo la cual tiene ubicado en el mercado más cercano a su residencia, así es como ella lucha día con día para poder mantener la economía del hogar. Ruth solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder hacerle unas mejoras a la vivienda lo cual consiste en iniciar la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio, pero como no tiene el capital suficiente para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita este crédito y así comprar arena, ladrillos, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra, y darle a su familia una vivienda más digna.
texts.en:
Ruth, 47 years old, lives in her own house with her family group, composed of her husband and her two children, ages 22 and 20. 

Ruth is a woman who each day rises with the hope of being able to carry out her work and, in this manner, earn the daily bread for her household and her children. Her income depends on the sale of beef and pork from her stall in the public market closest to her residence. This is how she struggles daily in order to maintain the household economy.

Ruth is requesting a loan through FUSAI to make improvements on her home. The project involves initiating construction of a bedroom. But since she lacks sufficient capital to be able to accomplish that, for this reason she is soliciting the loan to purchase sand, blocks, cement, and iron, and to pay laborers, in order to offer her family a more dignified home.

loans.use: to purchase sand, blocks, cement and iron, and to pay laborers, in order to construct a bedroom and provide her family with a worthy home.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 59 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and piglets to raise and sell.

Rosita has been raising pigs for 30 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 16 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines she also earns additional income from farming vegetable.  Gemma is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to  buy vegetables to sell for her business for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 36 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell beverage business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of beverages to sell for her buy-and-sell beverage business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 35 years old and married with two children. With her two children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like eggs, biscuits, home care products, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for two years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, biscuits, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Sharapat

texts.ru: Шарапат, 54 года, замужем, мать 4 сыновей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она уже много лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Шарапат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 10 овец и 30 коз. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,98 ГА, где она выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход Шарапат составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS). Шарапат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для закупки 8 овец. Шарапат намерена и дальше увеличивать поголовье скота и развивать ее бизнес, чтобы накопить на обучение ее детей в университете.
texts.en:
Sharapat is 54 years old, married, and the mother of 4 sons. She has a secondary education. For many years now, Sharapat has raised crops and animals as a source of income for her family. Thanks to Sharapat's persistence, purposefulness, and diligence, she now has 10 sheep and 30 goats. She also has a plot of land measuring 0.98 hectares, where she raises corn and wheat. Sharapat's monthly income is about 13,000 som (KGS).

Sharapat has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 8 sheep. Sharapat intends to continue increasing the headcount of her livestock and expanding her business so that she can save money for her university educations for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 8 sheep to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Victoria is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her fruit vending business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Naing

texts.en:
Nieang, a farmer with two children, is living in Bos Khnor village that is far from a power grid. As a farmer, he wants to expand his business with 7 hectares of big land and save utility fees. He wants to make his family living in comfortable conditions. However, his house has no reliable energy source.

He has to go to charge a car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometimes because of business he doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family is in a pitch black condition for the whole day.

He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a high quality home solar energy system. After using solar home energy, he believes his family conditions would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Bos Khnor Village, Thma Andeurk commune,Chetr Bore

loans.name: N15K6Lsơn-Thank Lenders Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thoan is 34 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling beverages for 4 years.
Thoan lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable . 

The main hardship that Thoan faces is lack of capital.  She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Thoan  first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N15K6LSơn-Thank lenders" group.
She is requesting a loan To purchase supplies to maintain her cafe and shop.
With her business profit, Thoan hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to maintain her cafe and shop

loans.name: Edenia

texts.en:
Edenia is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom in school, Edenia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, personal care products, etc..

Edenia has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Edenia would like to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индире 35 лет, она не замужем, одна воспитывает 3 детей, старшая дочь Индиры учится в 8 классе, сын - в 5 классе, младшая дочь - во втором. У Индиры высшее образование. Она всегда старается дать своим детям только самое лучшее, поэтому трудится не покладая рук. Уже 6 лет подряд Индира занимается перевозкой и продажей овощей и фруктов. Она сама на грузовом микроавтобусе через порой опасные горные перевалы по 4 раза в месяц привозит весной из Узбекистана, летом из города Бишкек и Ош свежие овощи и фрукты, и сдает их розничным продавцам под реализацию. В найме у Индиры -водитель, за один рейс он получает 5,000 сом (KGS). У нее наработаны постоянные покупатели. Индира развозит продукцию по селу, отдает продавцам под реализацию, все записывает в тетрадь. Безусловно, в некоторые месяцы в году торговля слабая, прибыльные месяцы - это ноябрь, декабрь, средние - сентябрь и октябрь. Ежемесячная прибыль Индиры - в среднем 28,000 сом (KGS). Также Индира торгует арбузами и яблоками, перевозя их с Ысыккульской области в соседний Казахстан. Старшая дочь Индиры во всем помогает маме, ухаживает за младшими детьми, когда она уезжает за продуктами в рейс. Индира понимает, что скоро дочери нужно поступать в колледж, потребуются средства на обучение, поэтому она решила заняться еще и животноводством. Индира помнит, как в детстве помогала родителям в содержании скота. Это будет ее новый стартовый вид бизнес-деятельности. Индира намерена купить скот и отремонтировать сарай. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS). Индира приобретет на часть этой суммы дойную корову для продажи молока, экологически-чистое оно будет пользоваться большим спросом у покупателей, а также будет полезно для детей Индиры. На 30,000 сом (KGS) купит овец, остальные средства направит на покупку строительных материалов для постройки сарая для скота. Индира привыкла, чтобы во всем всегда был порядок. Она подсчитала, что прогнозная прибыль от торговли и нового вида деятельности- животноводства увеличится примерно до 29,300 сом (KGS). Что и позволит Индире начать откладывать на высшее образование ее старшей дочери.
texts.en: Indira is 35 years old, unmarried, and raising three children. Indira's oldest daughter is in 8th grade, her son is in 5th grade, and her youngest daughter is in 2nd grade. Indira has a university education. She always tries to give her children only the best, which is why she works hard and keeps her nose to the grindstone. For six years Indira has been transporting and selling fruits and vegetables. She drives her cargo minibus over sometimes dangerous mountain passes four times a month to bring fresh fruits and vegetables from Uzbekistan in the spring, and the cities of Bishkek and Osh in the summer, and sells them to retailers on consignment. For her job as a driver, she receives 5,000 KGS for one trip. She has regular and loyal customers. Indira delivers produce around the village, giving them to sellers on consignment and recording everything in a notebook. Certainly there are months when sales are weak; the lucrative months are November and December, and the average months are September and October. Indira's monthly income is on average 28,000 KGS. Indira also sells watermelons and apples, which she brings from Issyk-Kul Province in neighboring Kazakhstan. Indira's older daughter helps her with everything and looks after the younger children when Indira is on a trip to pick up produce. Indira knows that her daughter will need to enroll in college soon and will need school supplies, so she has decided to open a new business and work in animal husbandry as well. She remembers how, as a child, she used to help her parents with keeping livestock. This will be her new start-up-type business. Indira intends to purchase livestock and renovate the barn. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS. She will use a portion of the loan to purchase a dairy cow to produce organic milk, which is in high demand, and which will also be used for her children. With 30,000 KGS she will purchase some sheep, and with the rest she will puchase building materials for renovating the barn. Indira is used to everything being in order.
