She has calculated that her expected profit from sales and her new animal husbandry business will increase to approximately 29,300 KGS. This will allow Indira to start saving up for her daughter's college education.

loans.use: to start a new business by purchasing a dairy cow and some sheep and to construct a barn for the livestock.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 50 years old and widowed with four children. With one child in school, Violeta works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: 25Phúhòa-Hlộc-Honest Borrowers Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thời is 48 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Thời lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Thời faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.
She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Thời's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "25PhúHòa-HLộc-Honest borrowers" group.
With her business profit, Thời hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is 61 years old with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Eliza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Eliza has been in this business for two years now.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Eliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Vivian works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Vivian has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Zhainagul

texts.ru: Жайнагул, 23 года, не замужем, детей нет. У нее неоконченное высшее образование, на протяжении 5 лет работает в сфере обслуживания клиентов. На сегодняшний деть, она работает в салоне красоты женским мастером-парикмахером, также наращивает ресницы, ногти, делает татуаж. Ежемесячная чистая прибыль составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жайнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку новых кресел, что позволит привлечь большее число клиентов. Доходы от кредита Жайнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, Жайнагул мечтает открыть собственный салон красоты. И конечно же она хочет найти хорошего молодого человека и выйти замуж.
texts.en:
Zhainagul is 23 years old, not married, and doesn't have children. She has an incomplete college education, and has worked in customer service for 5 years. Currently, she works in a beauty salon as a women's hairstylist, and also does eyelash extensions, nails, and tattoos. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further expand her business, Zhainagul has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy new salon chairs, which will allow her to attract a larger number of clients. Zhainagul plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in the further expansion of her business. Zhainagul dreams of opening her own beauty salon. And of course, she wants to find a good young man and get married.

loans.use: to buy new salon chairs so she can attract more clients.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch  is a 29-year-old married mother with a child. She has worked as a broom vendor since 2014. Her husband is a 28-year-old, earns main income from selling brooms as well. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia and earn approximately $11 per day. 

Now, Sreytouch requests a loan to buy brooms to sell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she wants to expand her business, build a proper kitchen and support her child to earn high education.

loans.use: to buy brooms to sell

loans.name: Kenzhegul

texts.ru: Кенжегул, 21 год, не замужем, детей нет, живет с родителями. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, занимается разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Кенжегул имеет в хозяйстве 4 коровы, 6 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает клевер для реализации. Вся деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 6,500 сом (KGS). Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Кенжегул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие хозяйства.
texts.en:
Kenzhegul is 21 years old, not married, and doesn't have children. She lives with her parents. As a source of income for her family, she raises livestock and crops. Thanks to Kenzhegul's hard work, she now has 4 cows and 6 sheep on her farm. She raises clover for resale on 1.0 hectare of land. All these activities bring in a monthly profit of about 6,500 som (KGS).

Having come to the conclusion that this is a profitable business, Kenzhegul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow to increase the size of her herd. She plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase one cow in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Sam Oun

texts.en:
Sam Oun, a farmer with 4 children, lives in Vattanak village that is far from power grid. Sam Oun have been a farmer for 15 years. Starting from a small land, he has been buying more and more land and expand his cassava farm up to 12 hectares big land nowadays. After day and night hardwork, Sam Oun wants to have a comfortable life style. 

However, his house has no reliable energy source. He has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because he is busy with his farm, he doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for many days. 

As a result, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for a solar electricity home system

location.town: Vattanak Village, Vattanak Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Women Do Business - N19Đồng Tâm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng is 39 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling snacks for 4 years.
Phượng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. .

The main hardship that Phượng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to make cake and processed food for sale.
This is Phượng first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to make cake and processed food for sale

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui est une femme divorcé âgée de 37 ans habitant à Agoè avec ses  deux enfants à charge. Kafui est une revendeuse des vêtements de friperies qui circule dans les quartiers et qui achète ses marchandises au marché deux fois par mois. Kafui sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des vêtements. Avec le bénéfice, Kafui pourra bien s’occuper des besoins quotidiens de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kafui is a 37-year-old divorcée who lives in Agoè with her two children under her care. Kafui sells secondhand clothes by circulating around neighborhoods and stocks up twice a month at the market. Kafui is seeking this loan to buy clothes. With the earnings, Kafui will be able to better take care of her children’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 120 articles of clothing

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Abdusattor is a generous man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. He is living in a beautiful place with hospitable residents. He is married and has one baby. 

His wife is an operator. She works at a government agency. Abdusattor is a farmer. He keeps and sells livestock. Additionally, to earn money to ensure his family, he works as a porter at a domestic store. 

He needs to earn more money to pay for his wife's treatment in the hospital. He hopes to have a healthy wife and a valuable life with his family. He asks for a loan to treat his wife in the hospital and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's hospital treatment

loans.name: Sharipa

texts.ru: Шарипа, 28 лет, замужем, есть 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 5 лет занимается земледелием и животноводством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 10,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Шарипы есть земельный участок мерою 0,6 Га, где она выращивает картофель. Также есть 4 коровы. Ее ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 22,000 сомов (KGS). Шарипа обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит 3 коров для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Шарипе развить ее деятельность и накопить на строительство дома.
texts.en: Sharipa is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. She has been growing crops and rearing animals for five years. She had just 10,000 som (KGS) as starting capital. Today Sharipa has a 0.6 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes. She also has four cows. Her monthly income is 22,000 som (KGS) on average. Sharipa has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with which she will buy three cows for fattening and resale. The proceeds of the loan will enable Sharipa to develop her business and save up to build a house.

loans.use: to buy three cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Ее зовут Рухшона. Ей 21 год. Рухшона талантливая девушка. Она успевает совместить учебу с работой. Рухшода дополнительно дома занимается шитьем одежды. Она любит свою работу и надеется, что в будущем может стать хорошим дизайнером одежды. Рухшона начала увлекаться шитьем в 2007 году и на сегодняшний день она без помощи может шить любую национальную женскую одежду. Рухшона просит ей помочь купить новую швейную машинку. Новая машинка позволит ей соверщить новые операции, благодаря новым функциям. Поддержите Рухшону.
texts.en:
This is Rukhshona. She is 21 years old. Rukhshona is a talented young woman: she is finding the time to both work and study. Rukhshona sews clothing from home. She loves her work, and hopes that in the future, she will be able to become a good clothing designer. Rukhshona took up sewing in 2007, and now she can sew any traditional women's clothing without help. 

Rukhshona is requesting help with buying a new sewing machine. A new sewing machine will allow her to accomplish new sewing tasks, due to its new functions. Support Rukhshona.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, 53 years old and married with five children, two of them in school, works very hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for seven years now.

Having repaid her previous loan, Yolanda has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, eggs, home care products, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned good, sugar, eggs, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Ama Bertine

texts.fr: Veuve et mère de trois enfants, Bertine est une femme habitant à Agoè  et âgée de 43 ans. Bertine est une commerçante ambulante  qui prépare et vend de la bouillie. Bertine achète ses marchandises au marché deux  fois dans le mois. Bertine voudrait  ce prêt pour faire l’achat des sacs de maïs. Avec la marge bénéficiaire réalisée, Bertine souhaite bien organiser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: A widowed mother of three, Bertine is a woman who lives in Agoè and is 43 years old.  Bertine is a door-to-door seller who makes and sells porridge. Bertine buys her merchandise at the market twice a month. Bertine would like this loan to buy sacks of corn. With the profit, Bertine hopes to plan for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of corn

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 49 лет, не замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, 10 лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 20 овец, 3 лошади. Дети с радостью помогают Бурулкан в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Ежемесячный доход Бурулкан от ведения бизнеса около 19,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи. Поэтому Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, что позволит ей улучшить материальное положение ее семьи и накопить на покупку мебели.
texts.en:
Burulkan is 49 years old, not married, and is the mother of 2 children. She has a post-secondary education, and she has been doing agricultural work for 10 years. She has 5 cows, 20 sheep, and 3 horses on her farm. Burulkan's children gladly help her with her business. She has everything that is required to keep livestock. Buruklan's monthly profit is about 19,000 som (KGS), and these funds are not sufficient for a dignified life for her family.

Therefore, Burulkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding. Burulkan plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further increase the number of her livestock, which will allow her to improve the material circumstances of her family and save to buy furniture.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Keleya au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 82 ans, Moussa est le père de 20 enfants âgés de 15 à 57 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture ont incité Moussa à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive l'arachide, le maïs  et le riz sur sa parcelle de 2.5 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et de bœufs. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour aider les enfants à plus travailler. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'être rapide dans le travail. Moussa espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et Étendre son champ l'année prochaine.
texts.en: Moussa is a farmer signed up with myAgro who lives and works in the village of Keleya in southeast Bamako in Mali. At 82 year old, Moussa is the father of 20 children ages 15-57, one of whom is currently attending school. Farming allows him to ensure self-sufficiency for his family, but the love of agriculture incited Moussa to become a farmer. He grows peanuts, corn, and rice on his 2.5-hectare plot, but must face a farmer’s challenges, such as lack of farming materials and cows. This year, he wanted to buy a seed drill to help his children work more. Access to a seed drill will allow him to work fast. Moussa hopes to increase his yield and income to be able to ensure his family’s self-sufficiency with food and to enlarge his field next year.

loans.use: to buy a seed drill

loans.name: Po

texts.en:
Po, an 65 years old man with a child, earns a living by farming in Bos Khnor village. Spending day and time rising his child, he wants to have a comfortable life. Currently he is still keeping on farming and helps his children business. 

Po has difficulty in using battery for home energy. He needs to recharge battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery, he decided to apply for KIVA to buy solar home energy. Po believes solar home energy can enhance his living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar electricity home system

location.town: Bos Khnor Village, Kanh Chor Commune, Chhlong Dist

loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es:
Cecilia mujer de 43 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde que actualmente se dedica a la cría, cuidado y posteriormente venta de ganado y porcino. De allí logra obtener los ingresos mínimos para cubrir las necesidades que su hogar amerita.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de porcinos (padrotes, lechones y hembras), con esto espera hacer crecer su ganado y que los clientes la busquen por calidad y economía.

Se sueña viendo su casa en buen estado, pues esta con tanto tiempo de construida se ha ido deteriorando.

Aporte a este sueño, haga un préstamo
texts.en:
Cecilia is a 43-year-old woman. She is hard-working and humble, and she currently makes a living raising, caring for, and later selling livestock and pigs. This work allows her to obtain the minimum income necessary to cover the needs of her household.

She is requesting a loan to buy pigs (males, piglets, and females). With this, she hopes to expand her livestock so that customers can look to her for quality and economic prices. She dreams of seeing her house in good condition; since it was built so long ago, it has been deteriorating.

Support this dream by making a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs (males, piglets, and females).

loans.name: Djiguitougou Junior Group

texts.fr:
Angèle est une femme âgée de 39 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants. 
Vendeuse des pagnes il ya 12 ans, elle fait la tontine et beaucoup de gens la connaisse qu’elle est dynamique. Son atout pour faire marcher son activité c’est la confiance que ses clients lui font aussi le stock de sa marchandise en permanence et varié. Elle veut le prêt pour s’approvisionner quantité de stock de pagnes différente qualité pour les revendre. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt huit (08) fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en: Angèle is a 39-year-old married mother of three. A seller of pagnes (traditional wraps) for 12 years, she does tontine and a lot of people know her to be energetic. Her advantage for making her business work is the confidence her customers put in her, as well as the permanent and varied stock of her merchandise. She would like this loan to stock up on pagnes of different quality to resell. She has already taken out eight loans and repaid them on time.

loans.use: to stock up on pagnes

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 24 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child in school.

Estrella is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Estrella has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 26 year old married woman living with her husband who is the main income provider in the family. He owns a cattle farm. 

In order to help her nephew with his education, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay his school educational fees. Her purpose is to help him achieve high educational levels.

loans.use: to pay her nephew the school educational fees

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a joyful mother. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1957 and is living in small and beautiful place with her family. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a taxi driver. For many years she has done business at the domestic and rural markets retailing grocery products, such as rice, macaroni, buckwheat, white candy, sugar and etc. She well knows her activity and has regular customers. 

In order to recover and to heal she requested a loan from IMON and Kiva to pay for medical services at hospital. She is hoping to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for medical service at hospital

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia Felicitas continua dedicándose  a la venta de productos secos como maíz, cebada, trigo y otros productos, la socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a su familia.La socia solicita el credito para comprar maiz,cebada y trigo.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member, Felicitas, continues to make a living selling dried goods such as corn, barley, wheat, and other products. She is a responsible and hard-working person who, through this business, is able to move her family forward.

The member is requesting a loan to buy corn, barley, and wheat. She is grateful for the loan that she has received, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley, and wheat.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a merchant residing in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She engages in a buying and selling business. She buys and at the same time sells coconuts. In addition to that, she also engages in selling copra (dried coconut meat). She is a married woman with three children ages 11, 8 and 7 years old, respectively. It has been 13 years now that she has been engaged in that kind of livelihood.

She has requested a loan to purchase more coconuts. With it, she will be able to acquire more supplies of coconut and be able to improve her earnings. Thus, slowly her obligation will be settled, and she will start to handle her finances. She could be able to provide her family with good food and a better shelter to live.

She is hoping that all three of her children will finish their respective studies for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts

loans.name: Bastiana

texts.en:
Bastiana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bastiana is 47 years old and has three children who are in school.
Bastiana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Bastiana requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Bastiana has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Bastiana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and married with five children.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Evelyn has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Viimkom Group

texts.fr:
Mme TATIANA est responsable du groupe  VIIMKOM. Mariée elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 22 ans et le moins âgé a 19 ans. Elle à 04 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des habits depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 15 douzaines d’habits.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une  maison et entretenir ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. TATIANA is the leader of the VIIMKOM group. She is a married mother of two, the eldest of whom is 22 and the youngest 19. She has 4 people in her care. Mrs. TATIANA has been selling clothing for 12 years. She stocks up at her neighborhood market. With the granted money, she wants to buy 15 dozen articles of clothing. She wants to use the profits from the loan to grow her business. She has the ambition of building a house and looking after her children.

loans.use: to buy 15 dozen articles of clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phone top-up cards, fruit, pistachios, cakes, table oil and bottled water

loans.name: Marilyatou

texts.fr: Marilyatou est âgée de 34 ans et mère de deux enfants qui habite à Agoè. Marilyatou est une commerçante ambulante qui vend des sceaux  et des bassines plastique  dans tout le quartier. Marilyatou  s’approvisionne deux fois dans le mois. Marilyatou désire ce prêt pour acheter des sceaux  et bassines. Dans le souci d’étendre son activité, Marilyatou prendra son épargne pour en faire bon usage.
texts.en: Marilyatou is a 34-year-old mother of two who lives in Agoè. Marilyatou is a door-to-door seller of plastic buckets and bowls throughout the neighborhood. Marilyatou stocks up twice a month. Marilyatou wants this loan to buy buckets and bowls. With the goal of growing her business, Marilyatou will put her savings to good use.

loans.use: to buy 102 buckets et 54 bowls

loans.name: Wendbenedo Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO est responsable du groupe  WENDBENEDO. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des habits et des pagnes depuis 11 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes, 15 douzaines d’habits prêts à porter et 20 paires de chaussures.
Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices .Elle ambitionne construire sa parcelle et compte aussi s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mrs. POKO is the leader of the WENDBENEDO group. She is a married mother of three, the eldest of whom is 14 and the youngest 4. She has 5 people in her care. Mrs. POKO has been selling clothing and pagnes (traditional wraps) for 11 years. She stocks up at her neighborhood market. With the granted money, she wants to buy 10 pagnes, 15 dozen ready-to-wear articles of clothing, and 20 pairs of shoes. She wants to save her profits. She has the ambition of building her lot and also plans to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes, 15 dozen ready-to-wear articles of clothing, and 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Mushgoa Multipurpose Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Florence; a member of Mushgoa multipurpose self help group. She is 53 years old, married and blessed with four children. 

She practices mixed farming; currently growing cabbages and kales and also keeps dairy. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy a calf and also buy fertilizer hence improve vegetables and dairy farming production for increased income. This will increase her income to enable her provide better food and clothing for her children.

Florence is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy a calf and fertilizer hence improve vegetable and dairy farming production for more income to provide better food and clothing to her children.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is a married woman with two children, both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 41 years old.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Cornelia has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

Lilibeth has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en:
Joralyn is 42 years old and has two children. Joralyn is married and has two children who are in school.

Joralyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Joralyn requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Joralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Barchaiym

texts.ru: Барчайым, 61 год, замужем. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Барчайым на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец, лошадь и 1,0 Га земли, где она выращивает арбузы для реализации. Барчайым обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, удобрений и клеенки для полеводства и выращивания экологически чистых арбузов. Доходы от кредита Барчайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Barchaiym is 61 years old and married. She has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops as income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, today Barchaiym has two cows, 15 sheep, a horse, and 1.0 hectares of land where she grows watermelon for sale. Barchaiym has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds, fertilizer and plastic sheeting to cultivate crops and grow organic watermelon. Barchaiym plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and plastic sheeting in order to grow organic watermelon.

loans.name: Wend Pagnagdé Group

texts.fr: Sylvie est une femme âgée de 47 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants. Vendeuse du bois et u charbon depuis 2000. Elle est la plus connue dans le quartier comme vendeuse du bois et du charbon. Elle vend à domicile. Elle à en permanent du bois, charbon. Les clients sont contents de son accueil et sont satisfaits de la qualité des produits sont pour elle un atout pour faire marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter deux (02) chargements de charrette de bois de plus que les autres chargements. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt  dix (10) fois et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en: Sylvie is a 47-year-old mother of four. She has been selling wood and coal since 2000. She is the most well-known wood and coal seller in the neighborhood. She sells out of her house. She always has wood and coal. The customers are happy with her welcome and are satisfied by the quality of her products, which is an advantage for her that makes her business work. She wants this loan to buy at least two cartloads of wood. She has already gotten ten previous loans, which were all repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy wood and turn it into coal

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Gouri is a 40-year-old woman from the village power house road of Koraput district, who works selling personal hygiene products, such as hand cream, deodorant, hair products, makeup, nail polish, and lotion. 

She began this work with the dream of generating income that would enable her to help her husband sustain the household and support their three adolescent children, who are still economically dependent on their parents. She is the featured borrower of Maa Laxmi SHG- A. She is the one standing to the right.

Once Gouri can maintain balanced sales with established clients and can better her family's quality of life, she wants to seek out her unfulfilled dream, which is to have her own house since she's tired of paying rent, and since she is already a business owner. With her current sales she cannot afford one, nor go into debt paying for it, so she needs to greatly build up her business. 

For this reason Gouri along with her group member, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. Gouri will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more merchandise, in order to double or triple her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, in order to double or triple her monthly income.

loans.name: Bark Wenaam2 Group

texts.fr: Djénéba est une femme âgée de 29 ans mariée  mère de trois (03) enfants. Restauratrice depuis 2009 elle est connue et a de la clientèle. L’emplacement de son hangars est un atout pour elle car, il est situé à l’autogare de lafiabougou un secteur de la ville cela  fait marcher son entreprise. Elle veut le prêt pour acheter deux (02) sacs de maïs, deux (02) sacs de haricot, trois (03) sacs de riz et des ingredients
texts.en: Djénéba is a 29-year-old married mother of three. In the food-service business since 2009, she is known and has a clientele. The location of her space is an advantage for her, as it is situated at the car station of Lafiabougou, a sector of the city. This makes her business work. She wants this loan to buy two sacks of corn, three sacks of beans, three sacks of rice, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy 02 sacks of corn, 02 sacks of beans, 03 sacks of rice, and other ingredients

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.es: Ana es una mujer de 42 años de edad que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, es por ello que hace 14 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de cocos cultivados en su terreno, obteniendo hasta la fecha una gran cantidad de clientes que visitan su vivienda en la cual tiene ubicado su negocio. Ella vive junto a sus 3 hijas de 19, 16 y 13 años de edad que son su orgullo. Ana desea realizar el cambio del techo de una galera de su vivienda que ya se encuentra en mal estado, por lo que ella desea adquirir un crédito que le permita invertir en: lamina, madera, clavos y alambre para poder realizar la mejora de su vivienda. Ana se siente agradecida con FUSAI ya que anteriormente obtuvo un credito el cual utilizo para hacer el cambio de techo de un cuarto de la casa y espera poder seguir contando con ese apoyo.
texts.en:
Ana is a 42-year-old woman who always looks for a way to move forward. For this reason, she decided to start selling coconuts grown on her land 14 years ago. Since then, she has obtained a great number of customers who visit her home, which is where her business is located. She lives with her three daughters, who are 19, 16, and 13 years old and are her pride and joy.

Ana wishes to change the roof of one of the spaces in her house because it is in poor condition. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to make this improvement to her home. Ana is grateful to FUSAI, since she previously obtained a loan that allowed her to change the roof of one of the rooms in her house. She hopes to be able to continue relying on this support.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to make an improvement to her home.

loans.name: Let Children Go To School -N54Minh Thắng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hằng is 40 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling breakfast and other meals for more than 10 years.
Hằng lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
The main hardship that Hằng faces is lack of capital.
  
In 2009, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. 

Hằng and 4 other women establish the loan group "Let children go to school -N54Minh Thắng" to get loan and share experience to do business for a better life.
She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to cook breakfast and other meals
With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain  a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to cook breakfasts and other meals at her stall

loans.name: Maa Bhima Dei Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Bana is a resident of Rasiaguda village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. She is 30 years old. Bana is the one standing to the left in a blue saree. She has a small family with her husband and one son and one daughter. 

The income of her husband is not sufficient to meet the household requirements. Hence, Bana thought of starting her own business to supplement the family's income. She started selling vegetables which include tomatoes, potatoes, cabbage, cauliflower, onions, ginger, etc. With this business she is currently earning 6,000 INR, but she wants to earn more to support her children's education. 

Bana, along with her group member Daimati, is seeking a loan of 36,000 INR. Bana will use her portion of the loan amount to expand her business by adding more fresh stock to her business, so that she will have more purchasing power to buy the vegetables from the wholesaler and resell them to her customers. 

The loan will help her earn more and give good education to her children. It will also pave the way for a good standard of living and happiness in her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding more fresh stock to her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a woman and 55 years of age. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nida has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Nida requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like dress, pants, etc..

Nida has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dresses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Maa Bhima Dei Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Nila is a 33-year-old mother of two daughters, aged 5 and 8. She lives in the village Rasiaguda of Koraput district. She makes a living selling agricultural products and specializes in dairy cattle. She is assisted by her husband, who is also responsible for helping set up the business in 2013. The woman standing to the left is Nila.

Diary farming is an expensive enterprise, and for this reason Nila, along with her group member Rukuna, is asking for a loan of 36,000 INR. Nila will use her portion of the loan amount to buy two more dairy cows and provide them with a better pasture. She will also use certain part of her savings with the loan amount in order to purchase cows. This will help make her business more efficient and sustainable, as well as increase her income.

Nila is a devoted mother and wife, and dreams of improving her family’s lifestyle by buying a home and paying for the education of her two girls.

loans.use: to buy two more dairy cows and provide them with a better pasture.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 43 years old and has three children. Gilda is married and has two children who are in school.

Gilda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gilda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gilda has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Maa Bhima Dei Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Radha, 41, is a vigorous married woman from the village Rasiaguda of Koraput district. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. 

She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day.The woman standing to the left is Radha.

Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well on his own. Radha’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She has one daughter who helps her in this embroidery work. 

She wants to grow her business so Radha, along with her group member Phulamati, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Radha will use her portion of loan amount to buy large quantities of raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls, to complete her customers' orders on time.

loans.use: buy large quantities of raw materials, such as thread, sequins, and pearls, to complete her customers' orders on time.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Rashmi is 42 years old. She has lived with her husband and 11-year-old and 17-year-old daughters in a home on their own property for the last four years. She is the lady standing on the left in the photo.

Rashmi has a small grocery set up in her home. She sells products such as sweet breads, sweets, coffee, sugar, eggs, detergents, soaps, etc. Through her business, she has been able to get her family ahead. Rashmi is the featured borrower of Maa Laxmi SHG-D (Self-Help Group D) from the village Power House Road of Koraput district.

Rashmi, along with her group member Parwati, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Rashmi will use her portion of the loan amount to renovate her bathroom which is in a precarious condition from the last year. She wants to rebuild the bathroom for her home so they can enjoy improved hygiene. Her family has had problems with illnesses related to contamination, and so she is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum. She will use the loan to purchase sand, gravel, iron, cement and bricks so she can rebuild a bathroom for her home and contribute to the health of her household.

loans.use: to purchase sand, gravel, iron, cement and bricks so she can rebuild a bathroom

loans.name: Maa Bhima Dei Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Sanamati is a strong minded woman who, through a lot of dedication and care, works to support her family. She is 47 years old, married, and has a beautiful family of three children, of whom only one lives with her. 

She is the featured borrower of Bhima Dei SHG-E from the village Rasiaguda of Koraput district. The lady standing to the left is Sanamati.

Some years ago, she began a food-selling business that was soon transformed into a restaurant. Due to her hard work she has been very successful. As she was unable to handle the workload in the restaurant by herself, she employed a workforce of two to help her, and her husband also helps her. 

Sanamati, along with her group member Debaki, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva’s partner People's Forum. Sanamati will use her portion to purchase essential items for the restaurant, including an additional stove, pots, and dishes. She will have enough to cater big and special events such as birthdays and weddings.

loans.use: to purchase essential items for the restaurant, including an additional stove, pots, and dishes.

loans.name: Forankognouma Group

texts.fr:
Korotimi est une femme âgée de 54 ans mariée mère de 07 enfants.
 Restauratrice depuis 12 ans, dont le restaurant est situé entre l’école primaire espérance-marché zone  noire et l’université. 
Son emplacement est un atout pour faire marcher son activité. Elle veut le prêt pour s’approvisionner en riz (3 sacs de 50 kg), huile (2 bidons de 20 litres) et des condiments pour la sauce. L’utilité du prêt c’est pour s’approvisionner pour son restaurant et avoir un bénéfice et s’occuper de sa famille. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 5 fois et à rembourser aux date prévues.
texts.en: Korotimi is a 54-year-old married mother of seven. In food service for 12 years, her restaurant is located between the elementary school and university in the black Espérance-Marché zone. Her location is an advantage that makes her business work. She wants this loan to stock up on rice (three 50-kg sacks), oil (two 20-liter containers), and spices for the sauce. The loan will be used to stock up her restaurant and have an income to take care of her family. She has already gotten five previous loans and repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy 03 sacks of rice, 02 containers of oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, beverages, and toiletries. She is a 41-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 14 and the youngest is 3.

She also engages in fishing. She catches and sells fresh fish. She has been engaged in fishing for more than 10 years already. She needs funds to support her fishing livelihood. 

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy fishing net and a machine for her motorboat. These will help boost her yield and enable her to improve her income. Thus, she will be better able to pay her obligations and handle her finances. She will be able to provide for the needs of her growing children and continue supporting their education.

Marcelina is determined to improve both of her sources of income to become more productive.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a machine for her motorboat

loans.name: Scariot

texts.en:
At 30, Scariot is a small-scale livestock and crop farmer by occupation. He grows maize as well as rear livestock. He owns a dairy cow plus two goats. Scariot is married with two children. He also takes care of two children belonging to his late brother. All the children are in primary school. Altogether the household has six family members. 

Income realized from milk sales is less than 70 USD and can hardly meet household essentials. Scariot wants to diversify his livestock enterprise by adding pigs to increase the profit margin so that he can be able to properly take care of his family in terms of providing household necessities. 

Therefore, he is looking for capital that will equip and enable him start pig production. The loan will enable him purchase pigs for breeding stock, cement for constructing a pigsty plus receive training related to the piggery. 

In the long run, after repaying the loan, he plans to use the returns to renovate his house by buying cement for plastering the floor plus iron sheets to prevent leaking during the wet season. 

He dreams of becoming a livestock lead farmer so that people in his community can consult him on livestock related issues. This is because currently, there are few livestock extension officers versus a large number of livestock farmers. Therefore with knowledge gained in pig production Scariot is very hopeful that he will be able to help his fellow farmers in aspects of dairy, goat and pig production.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid pigs, bags of cement for building a pigsty to build capacity in pig production.

loans.name: Jardan Shg-D Group

texts.en:
36-year-old Sunamani, standing to the right, is a mother of two children from a small village of Jamunda, in Koraput district, Odisha. She lives with her husband and children in a small house. Their children are studying in class 4 and class 3 respectively. 

Her husband is a farmer by occupation and he cultivates different vegetables in his farmland during different seasons and sells them in the market. Sunamani also assists her husband in field-work after managing her household works. 

Now, they have decided to cultivate paddy in their farmland which is an all season crop. Being the staple food of Odisha it has demand throughout the year, so they think it will be a profitable business which will generate good income. 

Thus Sunamani, along with her group member Ratnamani, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. Sunamani will use her portion of the loan amount to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manures, and a water pump to grow paddy. 

She has a lot of faith and hope of getting ahead with this business, because her household expenses depend on this business. With her profits she plans to purchase more land in the future and to provide good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manures, and a water pump

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.en:
Maria Catalina works hard to support her family. She has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Maria Catalina has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and married, and she has five children, one of whom is in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. 

Evelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase plastic bags and other supplies needed for her business. She has been in this business for 26 years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, and other supplies needed

loans.name: Maa Bhima Dei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Baidi, aged 32, is the featured borrower of Bhima Dei SHG-A from the village Rasiaguda of Koraput district. The woman standing to the right in a green saree is Baidi. She lives with her husband, who works in a car repairing shop, and two sons, aged 12 and 15 years respectively. 

Baidi is grateful that God has blessed her with a grocery store and eatery business for ten years already. It has been her stable source of income to support herself and her family’s daily needs. She buys essential food items from a wholesaler, such as canned goods, coffee, biscuits, beverages, and toiletries and sells them at retail prices. 

Aside from her small store, she also has a small eatery that sells simple snacks. At times her income is quite low, but being a positive woman, she is able to persevere and carry on her business with joy in her heart.

Baidi, along with her group member Manga, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva’s partner People's Forum. Baidi will use her portion of the loan amount to buy large quantities of grocery items to add to her store. Part of the loan she will use to buy ingredients like fresh meat, vegetables, and condiments to cook meals for her small eatery.

Baidi hopes to still grow and expand her store. She prays that God will continue to bless her with good health and long life so she can continue to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of grocery items to add to her store

loans.name: Romario Enrique

texts.es:
Romario es un joven con 20 años de edad, que se dedica  la venta de ganado y porcino, un medio por el que ha logrado salir adelante con su familia conformada por sus padres.

Para Romario no hay nada imposible, quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de remodelar su vivienda, pues sus condiciones no son las mejores.

Solicita un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos de levante y cuido de engorde.

Sabe que con el apoyo de todos los prestadores su sueño, se alcanzara.
texts.en:
Romario is a 20-year-old youth whose work is selling cattle and hogs, by which means he has managed to scrape out a living together with his family, his parents.

For Romario nothing is impossible. He wants to keep working in order to achieve his dream of remodeling their dwelling, which is not in very good condition. 

He has applied for a loan from Corporación Interactuar which he will invest in the purchase of hogs to raise and fatten.

He knows that with the support of all the lenders he will fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of hogs to raise and fatten.

loans.name: Shybel Mae

texts.en:
Shybel Mae is 19 years old with two children.

Shybel Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell beverages business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy and sell beverages, like Coke.

Shybel Mae has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell beverages business for three years and also earns an income from a general store.

Shybel Mae aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell beverages, like Coke.

loans.name: Yuset

texts.es: Yuset tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Estado de México. Ella es una mujer autónoma y con gran iniciativa. Desde hace 4 años ella inicio un negocio de venta de artículos por catálogo, como: zapatos y artículos decorativos. Ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 5,000 para poder comprar artículos alusivos a la Navidad, en esta temporada ella los adquiere a un precio muy bajo y su margen de utilidad es mayor. Lo que siempre la motiva a seguir a delante es su familia, ella dice que su tenacidad es lo que la define como emprendedora. Ella pretende en el futuro acabar su licenciatura en derecho. Ella agradece mucho a todos los prestamistas que confían en ella y la ayudaran a tener un margen de utilidad mayor.
texts.en:
Yuset is 38 years old and married. She has three children, and she lives in Mexico. She is an independent woman with great initiative. Four years ago, she started a business that consists of selling items such as shoes and decorations by catalog.

She is requesting a loan of MXN 5,000 to buy Christmas products. At this time of the year, she can buy them at a very low price, so her profit margin is higher. What always motivates her to move forward is her family. She states that her determination is what defines her as an entrepreneur. In the future, she hopes to finish her law degree. She gives thanks to the lenders that believe in her, who will help her achieve a greater profit margin.

loans.use: to buy Christmas products.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1953. She is living in a small city with hospitable residents. She is a widow and has three children. For many years she has done business retailing dried fruit. She was able to manage alone to raise and feed her children. She is challenged and works hard to ensure her children's well-being. 

Rahima has worked hard and her health has deteriorated. In order to recover and to heal, she needs to get treatment at a hospital. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to pay for her treatment at a medical clinic. She awaits your compassion and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for her treatment at a medical clinic

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more land and expand her farming.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan is 43 years old and a mother of four children; three of them are dependent children, and they all live in Kampong Cham province. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice crops and works as a construction worker to earn income to support her family. She has been involved in her current businesses for twenty-five years and it earns her about 40,000 KHR per day. Her rice crops are not growing well and part of it was destroyed by insects, so these have been obstacles to generating income for her. 

Due to not having enough capital for doing farming, she is now leading a group of two to take a new Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees in order to produce more output from her rice paddy fields. This is the second loan cycle for her and the previous loan helps her to have a better house to live in. 

For this new loan, she expects that her farming will produce higher yields than last year to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay labor fees in order to produce more output from her rice paddy fields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Joel Angel

texts.es:
Joel es un señor de 29 años de edad, con toda la disposición para trabajar, dedicado a la cría, cuidado y venta de ganado.
Trabaja todos los días entre 5 y 7 horas.

Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, cada vez su terreno es más grande y de tal forma el espacio para su ganado aumenta.
Solicita un crédito con el cual comprara cerdos (lechones), cuido de engorde, y cemento para mejorar las condiciones del punto de venta.

Su mayor sueño es poder pagarles la educación a sus hijos, pues le preocupa su bienestar.
Como Joel miles de empresario esperan de su ayuda, anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Joel is a 29-year-old man with a total willingness to work.  He works raising, caring for and selling livestock.  He works every day between 5 and 7 hours a day.

He has made great progress with this.  His land is growing and thus space for the livestock has been increasing.  He is requesting a loan with which he will buy suckling pigs, food to fatten them and cement to improve the conditions of where he sells from.

His greatest dream is to be able to pay for the education of his children since he is worried about their well-being.  Like Joel, thousands of entrepreneurs are hoping for your help; please make a loan.

loans.use: to buy suckling pigs, food to fatten them with and cement to improve the conditions of where he sells from

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 46 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, son, and pensioner mother in Batumi district. Mikheil wants to open a cafe and he needs some money to purchase inventory. The StartUp program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan to add to his money and purchase chairs and tables for a cafe. 

The family will run the newly opened cafe and they will work hard to satisfy all type of clients. Mikheil is very motivated to open his own cafe and he awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to open a cafe.

loans.name: Marlene Esmeralda

texts.es: Marlene de 23 años de edad habita en vivienda propia desde hace cuatro años junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es una joven admirada en su comunidad por ser trabajadora y amigable, Marlene ha trabajado desde muy joven para superarse y comprar sus pocas pertenencias y actualmente se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares y sus diferentes accesorios para lo que anteriormente solicitó un crédito para invertir en su negocio quedando muy agradecida por los resultados obtenidos ya que sus ventas aumentaron y con ello las ganancias mejoraron y así poder mantener la economía de su hogar, es por ello que en esta oportunidad con motivos de mejorar su vivienda solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para poder mejorar el área del corredor en cuanto a toda su estructura y piso  el cual actualmente es de tierra y desea encementarlo. Con el monto otorgado piensa invertir en: cemento, arena, lámina, hierro, alambre, pintura, etc.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 23, has lived in her own home for four years together with her family. She is a young woman admired by her community because she is hard working and friendly. Marlene has worked from a very young age to get ahead and buy her few belongings.

She currently sells cell phones and cell accessories. She requested a loan previously to invest in her business and is very grateful for the results she obtained. Her sales increased and therefore her earnings improved and she's been able to keep up the household finances.  

That's why with the intention of improving her home she is requesting a new loan from FUSAI, in order to improve the structure and floor of the hall area. The floor is currently earthen and she wants to cement it. With the approved sum she plans to invest in: cement, sand, sheet metal, rebar, wire, paint, etc.

loans.use: To buy: cement, sand, sheet metal, re-bar, wire, paint, etc.

loans.name: Luz De Maria

texts.es: Luz de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la fisioterapia y al masaje es una profesión que realiza desde hace 15 años su trabajo lo inicio con capital propio y esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo y los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de un ultra sonido portátil para poder trabajar como visitas de casa y poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 44 years of age and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. 

She works doing physiotherapy and massages. She has been doing this work for 15 years, and began with her own capital. She works out of her home and has many clients based on good work at good prices.

She is requesting a loan to buy a portable ultrasound so that she can do home visits in order to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a portable ultrasound.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 63 years old and married, with twelve children. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lourdes has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loans and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Johan Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe es un hombre con 28 años de edad, dedicado a trabajar en diseño de planos de construcción, una enseñanza adquirida por su hermana, y un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos y su pareja.
Trabaja 5 días entre 6 y 7 horas.

Para este trabajo necesita un computador, el cual  le facilita su trabajo ya que en este se realizan los planos arquitectónicos, pide un auxilio económico con el cual hará la compra de esta herramienta.

Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de pagarle la educación a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Felipe is a 28-year-old man who works drawing plans for construction sites. His sister taught him this job, and it has allowed him to support his two sons and his partner.
He works 5 days, 6 to 7 hours a day.

For this job he needs a computer, which will make his work easier since he is already doing architectonic plans. He is asking for a loan to help with buying this tool for his work. 

He wants to continue working so he can realize his dream of paying for his children's education and improving the conditions of his house.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his drafting work.

loans.name: Oscar Jose

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre campesino, trabajador y humilde que actualmente se dedica a la cría, cuidado y posteriormente venta de ganado y porcino.
Este es un medio por el cual este hombre ha tenido un gran progreso como familia y empresario.

Se encuentra solicitando el cual lo invertirá en la compra de  cerdos de levante y cuido de engorde, con esto espera aumentar sus clientes y de tal forma mejorar sus ganancias.

Su mayor deseo es ver su casa en buen estado, ya que con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando.
Aporte a la vida de este hombre, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Oscar is a hardworking and humble man from the country who currently works raising and then selling livestock and pigs. 

In this way he has been able to make a lot of progress with his family and as a business owner. 

He is requesting a loan that he will use to buy young pigs and to raise and fatten them up. These animals will allow him to reach more clients and in this way increase his income. 

His biggest wish is to see his house in good condition, since it has deteriorated over time. 

Contribute to improving this man's life by loaning to him today.

loans.use: to buy young pigs and to raise and fatten them up.

loans.name: Sujata

texts.en:
Sujata is 24 years old. She is married. she established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She uses her most recent loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. 

In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

 Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nisha

texts.en:
Nisha is 27 years old. She is married. She established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy fertilizers and seeds. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (tarakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Kamala is 47 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, one son and one daughter. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery stocks for her store

loans.name: Chanat Devi

texts.en:
Chanat Devi is 42 years old. She is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. In 2000, she established her furniture-making business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood for her business. In the future, Chanat Devi plans to improve her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support. 

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: To buy wood and tools for furniture making

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha is 58 years-old. She is married and has 1 son and one daughter. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, she plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery stocks for her store

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Babita is 31 years old. She is married and has one daughter, aged 14. In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Babita plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery stocks for her store

loans.name: Purna Pyari

texts.en:
Purna Pyari is 54 years old. She is married and has 2 sons. Their main occupation is farming and continuously doing same. With her sons, she started a side business opening a small pool (snooker) house for entertainment. Pool is very popular among youngsters nowadays and this is a good business for a side income. 

She had taken many loans from BPW and this recent loan is used for buying necessary things to run pool house and furnish that game parlur. With this she hope a lot for improvement in her financial status.

loans.use: To furnish a pool table (snooker) house and buy necessary things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheet metal, poles, nails and prongs.

loans.name: Gulandon

texts.ru: Эту простую женщину зовут Гуландон. Она из Шахринавского района. Ей 47 лет. Гуландон мать одного ребенка. Она вдова. У Гуландон нет высшего образования, но она умеет хорошо шить. У неё 10 летний опыт работы. Она очень красиво шьет и кроит. Все её клиентки довольны. К тому же у неё очень хорошо развита фантазия. Гуландон любит свое дело и довольна тем, что получает хороший доход. Если бы ни это работа она не смогла бы обеспечить семью, в частности своего ребёнка. Сейчас ей необходимо купить новую швейную машинку, но, к сожалению, у неё нет средств. Гуландон обратилась за кредитом с огромной надеждой, на то, что ей помогут, и она не останется без дела и своего дохода.
texts.en: This simple woman is called Gulandon. She is from the Shahrinav region. She is 47 years old. Gulandon is the mother of one child. She is a widow. Gulandon does not have a higher education, but she knows how to sew well. She has ten years of work experience. She cuts and sews very beautifully. All her clients are happy. She also has a very well developed imagination. Gulandon loves her work and is happy to get a good income. Without this job, she would be unable to provide for her family, and in particular her child. Now she must buy a new sewing machine but, unfortunately, she does not have the funds. Gulandon has applied for a loan with great hopes that she will be helped and that she will not be left without work and her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is aged 50 years and he supports three children. He has been a livestock keeper for the last 7 years and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month. 

He has applied for the first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients and meet their demands. 


David plans to use the profit gained to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and be able to provide medical services for his children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to supply milk to clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming rice and raising pigs. Margarita dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc

loans.name: Ludia

texts.en:
Ludia is 52 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Ludia has been in this business for 30 years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Kyzzhibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек, 35 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У нее - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Собственный бизнес начала в 2010 году и развила его. В хозяйстве Кызжибек есть 4 коровы, 21 овца и 2 лошади, на 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,2 Га собственной земли, она выращивает ячмень. На сегодняшний день ежемесячный доход Кызжибек составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Кызжибек планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, также она мечтает приобрести автомобиль для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Kyzzhibek is 35 years old, married, and has 5 children. She has a specialist secondary education, and she raises animals and crops as the primary source of income for her family. She began her own business in 2010 and developed it. Kyzzhibek's farm has 4 cows, 21 sheep, and 2 horses on it, and she grows barley on 1.0 hectares of rented land and 0.2 hectares of her own land. Kyzzhibek's monthly income is now 16,000 som (KGS). 

Kyzzhibek has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy 2 steers to fatten and resell. Kyzzhibek plans to use the proceeds from her loan to further develop her business, and she also dreams of buying a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy two steers to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Heiler Rafael

texts.es: Heiler es un comerciante de 25 años de edad, que inició su negocio cuando apenas cumplía la mayoría de edad, él fue motivado por un tío que le recomendó vender accesorios y teléfonos celulares, películas, radios y ofrecer servicios como recargas y minutos. Muy entusiasta decidió afrontar el reto en el que gracias a su dedicación y compromiso ha logrado tener éxito, su negocio es muy concurrido por los habitantes del sector en el que reside al sur occidente de Barranquilla y diariamente atiende a su clientela a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Como su prioridad es continuar trabajando para tener un mejor futuro, le es indispensable una inyección de capital para surtir con nuevas referencias de productos y  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en equipos móviles y nuevos accesorios.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir su propio local y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heiler is a 25-year-old shopkeeper, who started his business just after reaching adulthood. He was encouraged by an uncle who suggested he sell mobile phones and accessories, movies, radios, and services such as phone credit and minutes.  

He took on this challenge with a lot of enthusiasm and thanks to his dedication and commitment has managed to succeed. His store is much frequented by the people who live in the sector, in the south-western part of Barranquilla, and he attends his clients every day from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. 

Because his priority is to continue working for a better future, he needs to inject capital into his store to stock new references and products. He is applying for a credikiva, the first financing he has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest in new mobile equipment and new accessories.   

His goals for the future are to own his shop and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in new mobile equipment and new accessories.

loans.name: Matrone Maïmouna

texts.fr: Matrone Maïmouna est une agricultrice inscrite à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de N'Gouraba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 50 ans, Matrone Maïmouna est la mère de 6 enfants âgés de 12 à 30 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l'amour de l'agriculture ont incité Matrone Maïmouna à devenir agricultrice.
