loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers, organic agricultural inputs, coffee plants to convert their organic origin plantation to organic production.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin tiene 27 años y es un pequeño productor que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Se dedica a la producción de musáceas y café y es propietario de una finca de 3 manzanas, de las cuales 1 ha dedicado a la producción de café, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de las certificaciones de Comercio Justo.

Este pequeño productor asegura que el café es un rubro de gran potencial económico, por lo que para este ciclo está solicitando un crédito que le permita mejorar la productividad de sus plantas mediante la implementación de un manejo tecnificado y compra de insumos agrícolas que mejorarían grandemente la nutrición de sus cafetos, a fin de tener una mejor producción en los próximos ciclos y con ello lograr una mayor estabilidad económica para su familia la cual es su prioridad.
texts.en:
Marvin is 27 years old and is a small producer who lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua. He works growing bananas and coffee and is the owner of a farm which is 3 manzanas in size, of which he has dedicated one to coffee production, which he manages under the criteria for Fair Trade certification.

This small producer is sure that coffee is a field with a great economic potential, so for this loan cycle he is asking for a loan that will allow him to improve the productivity of his plants through the implementation of technical management and purchase of agricultural supplies that would greatly improve the nutrition of his crop, with the end of having better production in the future seasons and with this manage to have a better economic stability for his family, which is his priority.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies that he will apply to his coffee crop.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco, tiene 46 años de edad, esta casado, vive junto a su esposa en un sector de cofradía, Cortes. El siempre trabajo como jornalero y hace 5 años decidió con su esposa poner un negocio de pulpería para vender carnes, embutidos,  granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, lácteos, verduras y otros abarrotes. Ha invertido dos prestamos anteriores a su negocio para mantenerlo activo y ahora solicita otro que es el tercer ciclo en ODEF, y es por 25,000 Lempiras para surtir con mas producto y hacer crecer el negocio, comprara carnes, verduras, refrescos, azúcar, frijoles, huevos, pan, churros, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes. Su plan es mejorar su situación económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is 46 years old and married. He lives with his wife in a region of Cofradía, Cortes. He always used to work as a day laborer, but five years ago, he and his wife decided to start a grocery business. They sell meat, cold cuts, basic grains, soda, sweets, dairy products, vegetables, and other groceries.

He has invested two previous loans in his business, in order to keep it active. He is now requesting another loan, his third from ODEF, for 25,000 Lempiras to stock more products and make the business grow. He will buy meat, vegetables, soda, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, churros, bathroom products, and other groceries. His plan is to improve his economic situation, along with his family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soda, sugar, beans, eggs, bread, churros, bathroom products, and other groceries

loans.name: Tolotra Loyola

texts.fr:
Tolotra Loyola est  un père de famille très attentionné et responsable. Il a 28 ans et sa femme le soutient beaucoup dans l'exercice de son activité et l'entretien de la famille. Ils ont un petit fils de deux ans. 
Il est dans la vente des chaussures à l'occasion depuis 2013. Avant, il travaillait dans une société mais le salaire n'arrivait pas à couvrir les dépenses.
En général, c'est sa femme qui tient le point de vente fixe et lui il fait de la vente ambulante, il rejoint les différents  marchés dans les villes ou périphéries environnants et il se débrouille très bien. Il projette d'ouvrir un autre lieu de vente fixe. 
L'objectif de deux époux est de construire sa propre maison car actuellement, la famille habite dans une maison appartenant à ses parents et il voudrait être indépendant.
texts.en:
Tolotra Loyola is the father of a family who is very considerate and responsible. He is 28 years old, and his wife helps him a lot with his business and managing the family. They have a young son, two years old. 

Tolotra Loyola has been selling used shoes since 2013. Before that, he worked for a company but his salary was not sufficient to cover expenses. 

In general it's his wife who takes care of their sales location, while he moves around from place to place to sell the shoes. He covers the various markets in the town and its suburbs, and he manages quite well. He plans to open another fixed sales location. 

The goal of the couple is to build their own house because presently, they are living in a house belonging to his parents, and Tolotra Loyola would like to be independent.

loans.use: to buy various sorts of shoes: ballerina flats, high-heeled shoes, sandals, tennis shoes, etc.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.ru: Дилдора спокойная женщина из города Турсунзаде. Ей 30 лет, замужем и мать троих детей. Её муж находится на заработках в России, а дети учатся в средней школе. Дилдора шьет женские национальные платья. Она занимается этим более 5 лет.  Дилдора очень аккуратно шьет. Она выполняет на машинках или вручную подготовительные, сложные операции по пошиву изделий из различных материалов. Следит за контролем качества кроя, соответствием фурнитуры цвету и назначению изделия. Регулирует натяжение нити и частоту строчки. Поэтому у неё много клиенток. Им очень нравится её аккуратность в шитье. Дилдора хочет купить новую вышивальную швейную машинку и расширит бизнес. У неё мало средств и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Дилдора рассчитывает на Вашу помощь  и великодушие.
texts.en: Dildora is a calm woman from the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is away working in Russia, and her children are studying in secondary school. Dildora sews women's national dresses. She has been doing this for more than five years. Dildora sews very neatly. She carries out complex operations sewing products from various materials on sewing machines or by hand. She monitors the quality of her cutting and matches accessories to the color and function of the product. She adjusts the tension of the thread and the rate of stitching. Because of this she has many clients. They really like the accuracy of her sewing. Dildora wants to buy a new embroidery sewing machine and to expand her business. She has little money, and so she has applied for a loan. Dildora is counting on your help and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a new embroidery sewing machine.

loans.name: Bakty

texts.ru: Бакты, 45 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает библиотекарем в школе. На протяжении 23 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бакты есть 2 лошади, корова, 10 овец, также 0,70 Га арендованного и 0,31 Га собственного земельного надела, она выращивает ячмень. Также занимается торговлей в собственном киоске. Ее ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет около 22,000 сом (KGS). Бакты хочет и дальше развивать свой бизнес, поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров для увеличения товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Бакты планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего дела и хочет накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Bakty is 45 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She has a vocational education. She works as a school librarian. She has been rearing animals and growing crops for 23 years. Today Bakty has two horses, and cow, and ten sheep, and also 0.7 hectares of rented and 0.31 hectares of her own land where she grows barley. She also trades from her own kiosk. Her gross monthly profit is about 22,000 som (KGS). Bakty wants to keep developing her business, and so she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy goods to increase her stock. Bakty plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further growing her business and wants to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy products to retail in her shop in order to increase her stock.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнара, 48 лет, замужем, 2 детей. Образование - высшее, работает менеджером в собственном кафе. На протяжении 19 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 15 овец. На арендованном участке мерою 1,0 Га она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Гульнары составляет 27,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания для ее кафе. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в ремонт помещения кафе, чтобы накопить средства на постройку времянки и кухни в доме.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 48 years old, married, and has 2 children. She has a post-secondary education, and works as a manager at her own cafe. Over the last 19 years, she has raised animals and crops. Thanks to her very hard work, Gulnara now has 2 cows and 15 sheep on her farm. On a rented plot of land measuring 1.0 hectares, she raises barley. Her monthly combined income is 27,000 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her business, Gulnara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy food products for her cafe. She plans to use the proceeds from her loan to repair her cafe's premises, so she can save the money to build a stove and kitchen in her house.

loans.use: to buy food products for her cafe.

loans.name: Melugin

texts.en:
Melugin is 43 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Melugin is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melugin has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melugin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alberta is 49 years old and has one child in school.

Alberta has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Alberta has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anacleto

texts.es:
El señor Anacleto tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la Caficultura, actividad productiva con la que cuenta con 30 años de experiencia, ademas el se dedica a la ganaderia y cuenta con un foto estudio donde realiza ampliaciones de fotografía talladas en madera.
Don Anacleto gracias a sus negocios  el  obtiene los ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares y financieros contraidos, es una persona muy conocida en la Aldea por ser muy responsable y muy dedicado al trabajo, el crédito que esta solicitado es para la compra de  fertilizantes para su finca y esto le ayudara  a que le generen mayores ingresos en el hogar, su sueño es poder mejorar su finca y en las próximas cosecha obtener mejores resultados.


Trojes, Honduras, Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Anacleto is 41 years old. He lives in the community of Trojes in the east of Honduras. He primarily makes a living growing coffee. He has 30 years of experience performing this work successfully. In addition, he has livestock as well as a photo studio where he carves enlarged photographs into wood. Thanks to his businesses, Anacleto earns an income to cover household expenses and other financial obligations. He is a well-known person in his town because he is very responsible and very dedicated to his work.

He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his farm, which will help him earn a higher income for his household. His dream is to be able to improve his farm so that the next harvest can yield better results.

Trojes, Honduras - June 2015

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Zinatoy

texts.ru: Зинатой очень добрая и понимающая женщина. Ей 48 лет. Она мать троих детей. Зинатой всю свою жизнь посвятила детям. Сейчас она работает в супермаркете кассиром. У нее ответственная работа. Зинатой живет с одним ребенком в Душанбе. Она давно копила деньги на ремонт дома, но уже несколько лет ее мечте не суждено сбыться. Она очень хочет отремонтировать дом и обустроить свои стены, апартаменты как ее душе удобно. Зинатой не может больше ждать и начинает ремонт и просит ей помочь.
texts.en: Zinatoy is a very kind and understanding woman. She is 48 years old. She is the mother of three children. Zinatoy has dedicated her whole life to her children. Now she is working as a cashier in a supermarket. She has a responsible job. Zinatoy lives with one child in Dushanbe. She has been saving money to renovate her house for a long time, but for several years her dream has not been fated to come true. She really wants to renovate her house and to build walls and rooms to satisfy her soul. Zinatoy cannot wait any longer and is starting the renovations and asking for help.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Jardan Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Rupashila is a 44-year-old enthusiastic and optimistic woman living with her husband and a daughter who is continuing her studies in a secondary school in the village Jamunda of Koraput district. The lady standing to the right in a red saree is Rupashila. She is the featured borrower of Jardan SHG-B (Self-Help Group B). She has a goat farm in which she currently has 15 goats. 

Rupashila purchases goat kids and sells them for meat to the local butcher shops when they are grown. It takes 8 to 9 months for her to raise and sell them. She goes out in the morning to leave the goats to graze in the fields and returns by noon. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining these goats. In this way, she is earning to control her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. 

Rupashila says that there is a lot of demand during the months of April-July and October-December, the auspicious times for Indian weddings. Currently, she is not able to meet the demand during these months and other peak demand times. She, along with her group member Sabita, have requested a loan of 36,000 INR. 

Rupashila will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase some more goat kids to be able to sell more and seize the opportunity during the peak demand periods, as well as to construct a shelter for the goats to protect them from the rain.

loans.use: to purchase more goat kids so as to meet the demand for goats during peak periods and to construct a shelter for her goats to protect them from the rain

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 25 years old. He is married and supports a family with one child. For the past three years, Erick has been a farmer who earns 10,000 KES each month. 

Erick has applied for a 25,000 KES loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow. He will increase milk production and supply in his area. Erik hopes to us the anticipated profit from his loan to improve his dairy farm and increase his income. In the future, he hopes and dreams to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce milk

loans.name: Ivan Javier

texts.es:
Ivan es un hombre de 32 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de consolas de juegos electrónicos. 
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizada por su feria; que es considerada la más grande del país y dónde se puede encontrar desde un alfiler hasta un tractor agrícola. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Ivan es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por las actividades que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su madre que se dedican al comercio, viven en casa de su madre que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de consolas para videojuegos, estos se usan para entretener a una o más personas, por medio de un controlador, con un dispositivo dotado de imágenes de vídeo, “inicié mi negocio vendiendo como ambulante, repartiendo juegos a puestos fijos, recientemente pude adquirir un puesto de venta que está completamente desabastecido…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo en un lugar céntrico comercial, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio. Su sueño es vender en otras ciudades, él desea realizar la compra de video consolas para abastecer su negocio para inaugurar su puesto de venta. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ivan solicita un préstamo para la compra de video consolas para inaugurar su puesto fijo de venta y continuar mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivan is a 32 year old, single man with no children and his business is selling video game consoles. He is enterprising, independent, consistent, patient, responsible and very hard-working. He does his business in the ‘16 de Julio’ neighborhood which is known for it's market which is considered the biggest in the country where you can encounter anything from a pin to a farm tractor. It has a cold and dry climate with temperatures that vary during the day between 0 to 12 degrees Celsius.

Ivan is dark-skinned, has dark eyes, short black hair is short and of medium build. His native language is Aymará which he speaks with his family and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and his business. He shares his life with his mother who works in commerce. They live in his mother's home, which she owns. It is built of cement and bricks with a metal roof and a wood floor that has running water, electricity, domestic gas and sewage.

His business is selling video game consoles which are used to entertain one person or more, through a controller with a devise equipped with video images. "I started my business selling itinerantly, distributing games to regular sales stands. Recently I was able to acquire a sales stand that is completely unstocked", he commented. The advantage of his business is that he has a stand in a central commercial area. His disadvantage is is the lack of capital to buy merchandise to stock his business.

His dream is to sell in other cities. He wants to buy video consoles to stock his sales stand and then open it. This is his first loan with the institution in the three years he has been in this business.

For these reasons Ivan is requesting a loan to buy video consoles to open his permanent sales stand and continue to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy video consoles to open his permanent sales stand and continue to improve his business.

loans.name: Ndiag's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 7 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 12 décembre 2009. Il est constitué de femmes du même village qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et qui s'activent dans le commerce et l'embouche.
NDIAG à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 61 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 3 garçons et 4 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter 5 moutons. Elle travaille en collaboration son mari qui l'aide pour l'achat des moutons. Elle achète le mouton à 70 000 FCFA et le revend après élevage à 100 000 FCFA.
les bénéfices récoltés vont lui permettre d’acquérir d'autres moutons afin d'accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
This seven-member group belongs to the banc villageois which was created on 12th December 2009. It is made up of women from the same village who all get along well and who earn their livings through retail and livestock farming.

Ndiag, the woman to the far right of the photo with her hand raised, is 61 years old. She is a married mother to seven children; three sons and four daughters. With this loan, she wants to purchase five sheep. She works with her husband who helps her buy sheep. She buys sheep for 70,000 FCFA apiece, then after raising them, she sells them for 100,000 FCFA each. 

The profits she will make from this will allow her to purchase further sheep and allow her to grow her activity.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Laura Cristina

texts.es:
A su corta edad, la joven Laura logro consolidar su propio negocio, una farmacia, es un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante con su familia compuesta por su madre y padre.

Actualmente esta joven no cuenta con un gran surtido en su  negocio, es por esto que solicita un crédito en la Corporación Interactuar con el fin de abastecer su negocio de medicamentos como antibióticos, laxantes, analgésicos y el botiquín de primeros auxilios.

Sus sueños son muchos, pero primordialmente es comprar una vivienda propia para brindarle una mejor estabilidad económica y una buena calidad de vida a su familia.

Usted puede hacer parte de este sueño, anímese y haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
At her young age, Laura managed to consolidate her own pharmacy business. It is a means by which she has been able to get ahead with her family, which consists of her mother and father.

This young woman's business is not currently well stocked, which is why she is applying for a loan with Corporación Interactuar [Interact Corporation] in order to supply her business with medications such as antibiotics, laxatives, painkillers and a first aid kit.

Her dreams are many, but her primary one is to buy her own home in order to provide better economic stability and a good quality of life for her family.

You can be part of this dream. Go for it and give a loan.

loans.use: to supply her business with medications such as antibiotics, laxatives, painkillers and a first aid kit.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael, tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposa e hijos en una aldea del municipio de Nueva, Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Lleva 15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura sembrando chile, maíz,frijol y café que es lo que le genera mayor ingreso, este lo vende en pergamino húmedo y requinto en la misma zona o a intermediarios. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a ODEF por 13,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y aplicarle a la finca de café. Su meta es seguir cultivando café para ampliar la finca y los ingresos para vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en: Ismael is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in a village of the Municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Barbara. He has worked for 15 years in agriculture growing chile, corn, beans and coffee, which is what generates a larger income. He sells it in humid parchment in his region or to middlemen. He is requesting a second loan of 13,000 lempiras to ODEF to buy fertilizers and use them in his coffee farm. His goal is to continue cultivating coffee to expand his farm and income in order to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and use them in his coffee farm.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 65 years old and married with four children. For the past 15 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Sofia works very hard to provide for her family.

Sofia is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as biscuits, candies, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, home care products, and groceries

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
A 37-year-old mother of three children, Chanthy is a rural villager, living in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is a member of Chanthy's Group. 

Selling grocery items and growing rice have been the sources of her family’s income for ages and it earns her about KHR 34,000 per day. She could save about KHR 15,000 per day, after expenses on her daily needs. 

Her business does not do well during the raining season because the slippery road in front of her house is difficult to walk across. So, it has affected her daily income. 

This is the third loan cycle for Chanthy with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner, and her business is getting better through her previous loans. For this new loan, she is willing to spend the money to buy more kinds of grocery items in order to attract more customers. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of grocery items in order to attract more customers.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various sorts of toys

loans.name: Jardan Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Lakshmi is a 54-year-old divorced woman, the one standing to the left in a green saree, from the village Jamunda of Koraput district. She is the featured borrower of Jardan SHG-A (Self-Help Group A). She was happy with her children and her husband, a tractor driver. After 19 years of marriage, she separated from her husband due to personal reasons. At that time, she had a son aged seventeen years and a daughter aged fifteen years. She has been struggling since then to support her family.

Lakshmi started a snack and tea stall at her house, which is located quite close to the market. She cooks and sells local snacks and tea in the mornings and evenings, the general hours for such a business. She sells pan (betel leaf) on a small scale during the rest of the day to fill her day and increase her income. She hopes for a bright future for her children. 

With the six years of experience in running the shop, Lakshmi wants to expand her business to meet customer demand. She, along with her group member Haba, have requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Lakshmi will use her portion of the loan amount to buy some utensils and stock up on raw materials like besan (gram flour) and oil for cooking her snacks, as well as to buy new products like packaged snacks and wafers to stock in her food shop. 

Laksmi also plans to buy some furniture to provide seats for her customers as she sees an increase in her customer base. She says that the increased cash flow can change her life and provide better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy some utensils and stock up on raw materials

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is originally from Olympia and first opened up her coffee business, Royal Bean, in June of 2004. Before Royal Bean, Sally worked in legal services as a paralegal. She has a passion for marketing and sales in the coffee industry and started her business with her husband to serve great tasting coffee and pastries in convenient locations. Sally's long-term goal is to expand her business throughout the state of Washington. Over the years, Sally has worked long hours to watch her business operate successfully and become part of the Tumwater community. 

Sally is currently seeking a loan to purchase product inventory supplies for her coffee stand. She is committed to consistently developing and reaching short-term and long-term goals for her business. She is specifically focused on what Royal Bean needs to achieve on a weekly and monthly basis to meet the business's annual goals.

loans.use: To purchase product inventory supplies for her coffee stand

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
MARGARITA TIENE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD, SEPARADA, TIENE 04 HIJOS DEPENDIENTE, VIVE EN EL CASERIO DE HUABAL QUE PERTENECE AL DISTRITO DE SAN FELIPE, PROVINCIA JAÉN, REGIÓN CAJAMARCA, SIERRA NORTE DE PERÚ. EN DICHO CASERIO LA POBLACION SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA SIENDO EL CULTIVO DE LIMA EL DE MAYOR PRODUCCION, ASI COMO AL COMERCIO CASERIO MEDIANO CON ASPIRACIONES A SUPERAR.

MARGARITA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO CUENTA CON UNA BODEGA UBICADA EN SU PROPIO DOMICILIO EN EL CASERIO DE HUABAL LA CUAL VIENE FUNCIONANDO HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A LA CRIA DE GANADO CAPRINO, POR LO QUE CUENTA CON BUENAS REFRENCIAS PERSONALES Y LABORALES, EL DESTINO DEL CREDITO SERÁ INVERTIR EN COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA PARA AUMENTAR EL STOCK DE SU NEGOCIO, ASÍ SUBIR EL VOLUMEN DE VENTAS GENERAR MAYORES INGRESOS Y POR ENDE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Margarita is 45 years old and separated, with four dependent children. She lives in the small village of Huabal, which belongs to the San Felipe District within the Province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca Region of Peru’s northern sierra. The people in this village work in agriculture, with lemons being the most widely produced crop; and there are also medium-sized village businesses that aspire to improve.

Margarita has a business, a small general store located in her home in the village of Huabal.  She has been running it for more than ten years, and she also raises goats, so she has good personal and work references. 

The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise in order to stock her business more. In this way, she will raise the volume of sales and generate more income, thus improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business more.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 62 years old and married with five children. For the past 15 years, she has run a rice mill and retailing business in the Philippines. She also earns an income from farming sugarcane, vegetables, corn, and rice. Clarita works hard to provide for her family.

Clarita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy rice and pay labor salaries at her rice mill. She has borrowed and repaid 14 previous loans from NWTF. In the future, Clarita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice and pay labor salaries at her rice mill

loans.name: Relwende De Yaoghin 02 Group

texts.fr:
Mme Mme SALAMATA  est maintenant responsable du groupe  RELWENDE DE YAOGHIN 02. Mme FRANCELINE ne fait plus partie du groupe, elle veut se reposer. SALAMATA est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 18 ans et le moins âgé a 13 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle à 08 personnes en charge.
Madame vend des céréales depuis 14 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans  le  marché de son quartier.
Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de riz.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour agrandir son activité. Elle ambitionne aussi payer une parcelle.
texts.en: Salamata is the head of the Relwende de Yaoghin 02 Group. She is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is 13 years old. Both of her children are in school and she has eight people living in her care. Salamata has been selling cereals for 14 years. She buys her supplies at the local market. With the money she has requested, Salamta would like to buy 10 bags of rice. She wants to use the profits from this loan to reinvest back into her business. She also hopes to be able to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of rice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. For the past 15 years, she has operated a mat-weaving business in the Philippines.  Susan is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susan is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks and nipa leaves. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks and nipa leaves

loans.name: Xiomara Lisseth

texts.es: Xiomara de 30 años de edad vive con sus padres y un tío. Ella es una joven emprendedora que desde hace seis años se dedica al cultivo y venta de plátanos, actividad que realiza en su comunidad y gracias  a la cual logra apoyar a sus padres con la economía familiar. Xiomara con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida anteriormente solicito un crédito el cual utilizo para poder mejorar la siembra de sus cultivos y aumentar sus ventas y ganancias en el negocio, gracias a la grata experiencia y con el deseo de mejorar su vivienda solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI el cual piensa invertir en la compra de materiales como: ladrillo, arena, grava, hierro, etc. con el motivo de iniciar la construcción de su casa ya que actualmente habita en una la cual está hecha de lamina y no le brinda la seguridad que ella necesita.
texts.en: Xiomara is 30 years old and lives with her parents and uncle. She is a young entrepeneur, who for six years has worked in the cultivation and sale of bananas. She does this activity in her town, and thanks to it she is able to support her parents with family expenses. In order to improve her life conditions, Xiomara requested a loan previously, which she used to improve her crops and increase her sales and earnings in the business. Thanks to this pleasant experience and wishing to improve her house, she is requesting a new loan to FUSAI. She plans to invest it in materials such as bricks, sand, gravel, iron, etc., to start building her house, because currently she lives in one made of metal sheets that does not offer her the safety she needs.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, gravel, iron, etc. in order to start building her house.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра молодая и милая девушка. Живет со своей семьей в красивом районе Шахринав.  Ей всего 21 лет. Гулчехра замужем. Из-за финансовых проблем её любимый муж уехал на заработках в другую  страну. Гулчехре очень трудно жить без мужа, но она сильная женщина и сама трудится, чтобы жить. Она уже 3 лет занимается животноводством. Животноводство тяжелый, монотонный труд, тем более для женщины. Гулчехра очень любит свое дело, так как она получает от этого прибыль и сама может себя обеспечить. Сейчас ей срочно нужно купить несколько голов мелко рогатого скота и увеличит доход. К сожалению, у неё нет достаточно денег, и она решила взять кредит. Гулчехра верит, что с Вашей помощью она сможет увеличить поголовье своих животных и улучшит жизненные условия своей семьи.
texts.en: Gulchehra is a young and sweet lady. She lives with her family in the Shahrinav region. She is just 21 years old. Gulchehra is married. Her beloved husband has gone away to earn money in another country due to financial problems. It is very hard for Gulchehra to live without her husband, but she is a strong woman and works hard herself to live. She has been rearing animals for three years. Animal rearing is hard, monotonous work, especially for a woman. Gulchehra really loves her work, since she earns profit from it and can provide for herself. Now she urgently needs to buy a few sheep and goats and to increase her income. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money, and she has decided to take a loan. Gulchehra believes that, with your help, she will be able to increase the size of her herd of animals and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a few heads of livestock.

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es:
Al hablar de Jose no se puede evitar notar que es un agricultor de nacimiento criado y formado con los hermosos valores del campo como lo son la humildad y el trabajo, siendo estos dos los más representativos de los agricultores de Colombia. 

Jose, no conforme con los ingresos que obtenía como agricultor decidió montar un negocio de comercialización para complementar su actividad ya que necesita aumentar sus ingresos para darle una mejor educación a sus tres hijos, es por esta razón que el señor Jose solicita un crédito para la compra de granos de café al por mayor, los mismo que revenderá para obtener algo de utilidad.

Su sueño es que dios le permita tener salud para trabajar incansablemente y poder generar buenos ingresos para comprar vivienda.
texts.en:
When speaking to José, it's hard not to notice that he is a farmer who was born and raised with the famous countryside values: humility and work, the two two most representative characteristics of farmers in Colombia.

Unhappy with his income from farming, José decided to start a business to complement his work as he needs to increase his income in order to give his three children a better education. José is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy coffee grains in bulk to re-sell and earn a little profit.

José's dream is that God will give him the health he needs to work without stopping, and to earn a good income in order to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy coffee grains in bulk to re-sell and earn a little profit.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace mas de un año, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda introduciendo el servicio de energía eléctrica ya que actualmente no posee luz propia, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para el pago de la instalación y compra de materiales eléctrico y así tener una vivienda digna junto con su madre.
texts.en: The young woman is 29 years old and has her face pixelated because she lives in a high risk area. She has been working at a private company for more than a year. She is able to support herself with what she earns. The young woman lives in her own home with her mother. She wants to improve her house by adding electricity since she does not currently have her own electricity. What she earns from her job is not enough to do this which is why she is requesting a loan from Integral to pay for the installation and to purchase electric materials so that she can have a decent home with her mother.

loans.use: to pay for the installation and the purchase of electric materials.

loans.name: Kunja Bihari Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Kanak, aged 45, is married with three children. She is the featured borrower of Kunja Bihari SHG-A (Self-Help Group A) from the village Behera Street of Koraput district. She is the lady standing on the right. Her husband works as a labourer in a nearby town. The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenditures.

The place where Kanak lives is rural but close to the city. The inhabitants get water from wells or from the river. Actually, the water is not fit for consumption. "Our need is for water in the kitchen as the river water is contaminated," she says. The advantage of her house is that it is close to recent water connections and the disadvantage is the lack of money to connect to the running water.

Her dream is to finish the construction of her house. She wants to undertake the water connection for her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry to stop using well water and provide her family with healthy water.  For these reasons Kanak, along with her group member Pinki, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Kanak will use her portion of the loan amount  to connect to running water for her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry so that her family uses healthy water.

loans.use: to connect running water to her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry so that her family can use healthy water.

loans.name: Yolber Javier

texts.es:
Con mucho empuje y perseverancia, Yolber desea iniciar un negocio de cría de peces en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Tierra Alta.

Esta idea surge a partir de la necesidad de generar unos buenos ingresos para colaborar con el sostenimiento del hogar en que vive con sus hijos y su esposa.

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre alegre y muy colaborador, cualidades que han hecho que se gane el cariño y respeto de la gente de la vereda.
Con este préstamo podrá dar inicio a este negocio.

El dinero será invertido en la compra de alevines y alimentos para los mismos.
texts.en: With a lot of effort and perseverance, Yolber hopes to start a business raising fish in his home in the city of Tierra Alta.  This idea came about from his need to earn a solid income to provide for his household, which consists of his children and his wife.  He is a happy and helpful person, which has allowed him to gain the goodwill and respect of others.  With this loan he will be able to start this business.  The money will be used to purchase young fish and food for them.

loans.use: to purchase young fish and food for them.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Agée de 43 ans, Abla est une femme mariée avec trois enfants à charge habitant à Agoè. Commerçante de chaussures, Abla achète ses marchandises au marché trois fois par mois et les revendent de quartiers en quartiers. Abla voudrait de ce prêt pour acheter des chaussures. Abla souhaite avec l’épargne qui en  résultera investir dans la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Abla, aged 43, is a married woman with three children to support living in Agoè. A shoes merchant, she purchases her merchandise at the market three times a month and resells them from district to district. Abla would like this loan to purchase some shoes. With her resulting savings, she would like to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase 120 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Leidy Yuliana

texts.es:
En la cría de aves encuentran muchas personas una gran oportunidad de vida y desarrollo, tal es el caso de Leidy que con sus 45 años tiene un pequeño negocio de cría de gallinas ponedoras y pollos de engorde, los cuales alimenta para venderlos posteriormente.

Vive en el municipio de Cañasgordas donde comparte su vida con sus 2 hijos.
Es una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora y sincera.

En los ojos de esta campesina se refleja el esfuerzo y el pasar de los años con un gran corazón y con enseñanzas para sus hijos.

Solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de gallinas, pollos y alimento para los mismo, de este forma lograra aumentar su producción y mejorar su capital de trabajo para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Many people find an opportunity to make a living and progress through raising chickens. Such is the case of Leidy who at the age of 45 has a small chicken farming business, raising laying hens and broilers which she feeds in order to later sell.

She lives in the town of Cañasgordas where she shares her life with her two children. It is a humble, hardworking and honest family.

In her eyes are reflected the effort and the years that she has lived with a big heart and with lessons for her children.

She is requesting financial support in order to purchase hens, broilers and feed for them. In this way she will be able to increase production and improve her working capital so that she can provide better financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase hens, broilers and chicken feed in order to increase production.

loans.name: Ayawa  Eugenie

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Eugenie est une femme mariée âgée de 55 ans qui habite à Agoè. Eugenie est une revendeuse de fruits  qui payent ses marchandises au marché. Eugenie sollicite ce prêt pour se procurer des oranges et des mangues. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, Eugenie profitera pour réorganiser son commerce.
texts.en: The mother of four, Eugenie is a married woman, age 55, who lives in Agoè. She is a retailer of fruit and buys her merchandise at the market. She is requesting this loan to procure oranges and mangos. She will take advantage of the resulting profit to reorganize her commerce.

loans.use: to purchase 9 baskets of oranges and 9 baskets of mangos

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio Luis sigue dedicándose  a la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la ganadería , el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abono entre otros.
texts.en:
Luis continues to earn a living farming, raising small animals, and raising livestock. He feels grateful for the loan that he has been granted, and he is committed to making his payments on time. 

He is a responsible and persevering person, which is how he provides for his family. On this occasion, he needs the loan in order to purchase compost and other items.

loans.use: to purchase compost and other items.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is 29 years old. He lives with his mother in Chkhorotsku district. Rezo and his mother receive a pension from the government as they are refugees. 

Rezo is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he owns a plot of land where he grows maize and nut trees. He sells the harvest locally. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan for renovating his flat. As the flat is renovated, he will rent it out and will get a stable income. Rezo awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to have stable income

loans.name: Yawa  Claire

texts.fr: Claire est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans habitant à Agoè. Mère de  deux enfants, Claire est une commerçante de riz mélangé du haricot qui vend  à domicile. Claire  achète son nécessaire au marché et effectue ses  achats trois fois par mois. Claire désire ce prêt pour l’achat des  sacs de riz et  bols du haricot.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Claire compte améliorer sa prestation de vente.
texts.en: Claire is a married woman, 32 years old, living in Agoè. The mother of two, she sells rice and beans mixed together, at her home. She purchases her necessities at the market three times a month. She would like this loan to purchase sacks of rice and bowls of beans. With the resulting profits, Claire is planning on improving her sales offerings.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of rice and 4 bowls of beans

loans.name: Kunja Bihari Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Monalisha, aged 27 years, from the village Behera Street of Koraput district is the featured borrower of Kunja Bihari SHG-B (Self Help Group B) of Koraput district. She is the one standing to the left in the photograph. Monalisha lives with her husband who works as a taxi driver and with three children who are currently pursuing their education in school. 

Monalisha exemplifies hard work and excellence. She has helped her family get ahead with her bakery business, selling items door-to-door throughout the streets of her community for the last four years. She started this business with income she earned through her previous work. The thing that she lacks is a proper bathroom in her house. She is very much concerned about the health and hygiene of her family. She wants to protect herself and her family from the diseases that are caused by open sanitation.

Demonstrating her responsibility, Monalisha, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Monalisha will use her portion of the loan amount in order to build a bathroom in her home so that she will be able to protect herself and her family from harmful diseases and maintain their hygiene. "After all, prevention is better than cure," she adds.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in her home

loans.name: Virgin

texts.en:
Virgin is 50 years old and has two children. Virgin is married and has one child who is still in school.

Virgin is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Virgin requested a PHP 35000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Virgin has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Virgin would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Jorge Del Carmen

texts.es: Jorge de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de minutas de manera ambulante en su carretón por las diferentes colonias, tiene muchos clientes ya que su producto es muy vendible, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de marquetas de hielo, jaleas de sabores y mejorar el carretón que muestra en la fotografía y poder seguir con su trabajo ya que es es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Jorge is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He sells shaved ice snacks from his cart as a street vendor through the different neighborhoods. He has a lot of customers because his product is very marketable. With his profits he is able to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy blocks of ice, flavored syrups and to improve his cart--shown in the photograph--so that he can continue with his work since it is his source of income.

loans.use: to buy blocks of ice, flavored syrups and to improve his cart.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase fishing net use for fishing for her fishing business.

Aiza has been in this business for 3 years. Aiza earns more income from seaweed cultured.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net used for fishing

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 26 years old and with one child.

Anna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Anna has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Anna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virginia is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Virginia has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre de 21 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, dedicado a la preparación y venta de pan, un negocio que logro montar desde hace poco y del medio por el cual se generen los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento.
Trabajo todos los días durante 6 horas diarias.

En el momento su negocio presenta una dificultad, pues no cuenta con la mayoría de los implementos que se requieren para esta actividad, es por esto que solicita un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de un horno e insumos como aceite, harina y sal.

Para este hombre no hay nada imposible, quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de tener una vivienda propia y así poder gozar de una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruben is a man of 21 years of age. He is hardworking and humble and works making and selling bread. He was able to set up this business recently for it to be the means by which he generates the income necessary to support himself. He works every day for six hours a day. 

His business currently has a problem because he does not have most of the tools required for this business. This is why he is requesting a loan which he will invest in buying an oven and supplies like oil, flour and salt. 

For this man, nothing is impossible. He wants to continue working to fulfill his dream of having his own home so that he can enjoy a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an oven and supplies such as oil, flour and salt.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie, a youthful 32-year-old mother, is a wise farmer who is respected by her neighbors and fellow farmers as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Bomet, which is in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Her primary income sources are eggs, milk and a side business. Winnie finds farming to be very enjoyable. However, as she is aging, she is finding dairy farming to be challenging. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfilment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business since the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Winnie is going to make more income that will enable her to take care of her family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Winnie is doing all she can do to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.
 With the loan that you make today, you will be able to improve Winnie’s life and her poultry business!

loans.use: To buy poultry for the expansion of her farm

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 24 years old and married with one child. She lives in a rural community outside of Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She owns and operates a small general store selling food items such as canned food, rice, sugar, salt, noodles and biscuits and has been doing this for two years.

Antonia needs a loan to buy more food items to restock her goods for her business to run smoothly. She plans to expand her business with the profits she makes and also cover her family's daily expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy canned food, rice, salt, sugar, noodles and biscuits for her general store.

loans.name: Flomena

texts.en:
Speaking with Flomena, it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman, and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and wellbeing. She lives in a humble home in the town of Bomet, along with a handsome husband and their two angelic-looking children. She has always strived to give them a decent life and a good education. She is a rural farmer from an area known for producing long-distance runners who have broken major world records. Flomena works with a great deal of determination, for many hours, on her farm, all to bring decent food to her home and be her family’s support. Flomena is blessed with a lovely family, and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. On her farm, she grows maize and keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she also often engages in small personal business to make extra money.

Farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction despite the low earnings. Flomena said, "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" Her biggest challenge, however, is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. To a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family.

Because of this challenge, Flomena formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. Flomena is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Flomena is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, with good health and a good livelihood.

Help out this humble smallholder farmer from the lands of Kenya with a loan!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Faniry Natacha

texts.fr:
Faniry Natacha est une jeune femme dynamique de 20 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari qui a 24 ans est tôlier-mécanicien. Ils ont ensemble un petit garçon de deux ans pas encore scolarisé.
Pour aider son mari à entretenir le ménage, Faniry Natacha exerce une activité de vente de bijoux de fantaisie et plaqués or: colliers, boucles d'oreilles, bracelets, faux perles etc.... Elle est bien achalandé car en ce moment même , on sait que le vrai or n'est pas à la portée de tous. Les jeunes filles et les femmes en générales sont attirées par ce genre de bijoux.
Le rêve des deux époux est de pouvoir construire leur propre maison avec leurs propres efforts, c'est la raison de leur acharnement à travailler dur et infatigablement dès maintenant.
texts.en: Faniry Natacha, aged 20, is a young energetic woman who is married. Her husband is 24 and a sheetmetal worker and mechanic. Together they have a little boy, aged 2, not yet in school. To help out her husband in maintaining the household, Faniry Natacha operates a business selling gold-plated costume jewelry: necklaces, earrings, bracelets, faux pearls, etc….. She is doing brisk business, since solid gold is currently not in within reach of everyone. Girls and women in general are attracted to this type of jewelry. The couple’s dream is to build a house of their own through their own efforts. This is why they are now working fiercely and without rest.

loans.use: to purchase gold-plated jewelry

loans.name: Charmaine

texts.en:
Charmaine is 37 years old with four children. With three children in school, Charmaine works very hard to provide for them.

Charmaine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Charmaine has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Charmaine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Hea's Group

texts.en:
Hea is a farmer living in Battambang province. She is 43 years old, and she is a mother of two kids. She struggles for a living via buying corn​​​​ to boil for sale as the main source of income. Meanwhile, she also sells potatoes to supplement her family’s income. She has been involved in these jobs for 13 years already. 

Her current businesses earn her profits, so she would like to expand her business. The lack of capital is her main challenge, which causes her to decide to take a new loan via VisionFund. This is the third loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Those previous loans have helped her to support her children’s education. 

She is now leading a group of two to apply for a new loan to buy more corn and potatoes to boil for sale in order to increase her income. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income from her current business to improve her family’s living conditions, much better than before.

loans.use: to buy more corn and potatoes to boil for sale in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.ru: Человек позитив, и никак не назвать этого человека. А зовут его Аслан. Ему 25 лет. Он прекрасный семьянин, муж и отец. Аслан вместе с женой воспитывают двоих детей. Аслан занимается продажей детской одежды. В торговой деятельности он занят уже 6ой год и набрался хорошего опыта. Аслан хочет расширить деятельность. Он планирует привести больше товара, увеличить ассортимент одежды и тем самым привлечь больше клиентов. Аслан просит ему помочь в его плане. Он уверен, что его ждет успех, и его поддержат.
texts.en:
Being positive, that's what this man is all about. His name is Aslan, 25 years old. He is a good family man, husband and father. Aslan and his wife raise two children together. 

Aslan sells children clothes for a living. He has been involved in this business for six years and has gathered relevant experience in the meantime. Aslan  would like to expand his business. He is planning to order more goods, increase the product range, thereby attracting more customers. Aslan is asking for your help to bring his plan to life. She is confident in success and hopes for your assistance.

loans.use: to expand the range of children clothes

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre de 54 años de edad, separado, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, dedicado, constante, paciente, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la urbanización ‘el recreo’ de la ciudad, la región de mayor crecimiento, representada mayormente por la producción agropecuaria y forestal, es la zona más importante de producción hidrocarburífera. Situada a una altura de 437 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-34 grados centígrados. 
Alberto es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello grisaceo corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultural general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus  familiares que son mayores de edad e independientes. Vive en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento, que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, agua, azúcar, aceite, fideo, harina,  arroz, manteca, refrescos, papel, galletas, productos de limpieza, etc., en su tienda de barrio durante toda la semana en horas del día. Debido a la falta de comercio en el área no cuenta con competencia, “mi tienda abastece a gran parte de la zona, es por eso que tengo ventas diarias y constantes…” comenta. Paralelamente a su tienda de barrio él tiene un vehículo que lo hace trabajar como transporte público, el carro fue financiado por el banco y le falta la última cuota para terminar de pagarlo. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer su tienda y pagar la última cuota de su auto. Su sueño es mejorar sus negocios, él desea realizar la compra de abarrotes y pagar la última cuota de su auto para que continué trabajando. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Alberto solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes y pagar la última cuota de su auto para continuar trabajando con ambas actividades.
texts.en:
Alberto is a 54 year old man, separated, with adult children, and his business is selling food and basic items everyone needs in his neighborhood store.   He is a good father, enterprising, dedicated, steady, patient, responsible  and very hard working.  He is developing his business in the city neighborhood called "El Recreo", the area where the most growth is taking place, mostly through forest and agricultural production.  This is the most important area for production of  hydrocarbon,and is located 437 meters above sea level, with a warm sub-tropical climate, and temperature varying during the day between 21 and 34 degrees Centigrade. 

   Alberto  has brown skin, dark eyes,and short greying hair.  He is short, with a  stocky build.  Alberto's first language is Guarani, which is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish at work.  He shares his life with family members who are adult and independent.  Alberto lives in a family house built of bricks and cement, with a metal sheeting roof and cement floor.  The house has electricity, running water and a sewer system.  His business is the sale of food and items needed everyday such as bread, water, sugar, oil, noodles, floor, rice, butter, soft drinks, paper, crackers, and cleaning products in his neighborhood store daily during the week. 

 Due to the lack of business in the area, Alberto doesn't have to worry about competition.  "My store supplies a large part of the area; that is why I have daily, frequent sales, " he says.  Besides his neighborhood store, Albert has a vehicle he uses to work by transporting people.  The car was financed by the bank, and the last payment to complete the loan is needed.  The advantage his store has is that sales are daily; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to supply his store and make the last loan payment for his car.  Alberto's dream is to improve his two lines of work. He wants to buy groceries and make the last payment on the car so he can continue working.  This is the first sequence of loans Alberto has sought from the organization in the 15 years he has worked at this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and make the last payment on his car in order to keep working in two ways

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raffia, straps, leather, rivets, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married woman, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like bags, shirts, etc. for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bags, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyen is a hardworking woman, 23 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from vocational brooms and husbandry. 

She would like to take the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build a latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат молодая девушка из города Душанбе. Ей 30 лет. Саноат занимается шитьем одежды на дому.  Она мать одиночка. Саноат она растет сына. Сыну 7 лет. Скоро он пойдет в школу. Чтобы обустроить ребенка нужно внести сумму, потом купить форму для школы, учебники, тетради и другие учебные принадлежности. Для Саноат это очень дорого, но она не может допустить, чтобы его ребенок остался без образования, тем более первоначального. Саноат обратилась за кредитом. Она просит ее поддержать собрать ребенка в школу.
texts.en: Sanoat is a young woman living in Dushanbe. She is 30 years old. She sews clothes from home for a living. She is a single mom raising a son. Her son is seven years old. He is about to go to school. To ensure his education, a fee needs to be paid, and afterwards school uniform, textbooks, notebooks and other school supplies have to be purchased. These expenses are very high for Sanoat, but she cannot leave her child uneducated, especially without primary education. That's why Sanoat requested a loan. She is asking for your help to prepare her child for school.

loans.use: To buy textbooks and school supplies to send her kid to school

loans.name: Nery Alexis

texts.es:
El señor  Nery, tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su actividad principal es la caficultura, actividad que le generan muy buenos recursos, cuenta con más de 13 años de  dedicarse  a este tipo de actividad económica y para este año espera una muy buena producción. 
Don Nery está  solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono ya que por los momentos no cuentan con los recursos suficientes para abonar sus cultivos y espera que esta inversión le permita mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Don Nery su sueños es mejorar las condiciones de vida y tener una estabilidad económica en el futuro, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños.

Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2015
texts.en:
Nery is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and his main activity is growing coffee, an activity that generates very good income. He has been doing this type of financial activity for more than 13 years and he expects a good yield this year. 

Nery is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer, since at this time they don't have enough resources to fertilize the crops. He hopes that this investment will allow him to improve his income and cover the family expenses and financial commitments.
 
Nery's dream is to improve his standard of living and have financial stability in the future. The support he will receive with the loan will contribute to achieving his dreams.

Trojes, Honduras - June, 2015

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his business.

loans.name: Concepción Del Carmen

texts.es:
Algunas zonas de Nicaragua no cuentan sistemas de alcantarillado, por ello MiCrédito ofrece un paquete de financiamientos para ayudarles a esas familias a mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Por esta razón, Concepción solicitó un crédito para construir un servicio higiénico.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, que se dedica a la confección de  ropa y de manteles, que le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a sus hijos. Entre los planes de  Concepción esta ampliar su campo laboral y continuar mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Some areas of Nicaragua don’t have sewer systems, so MiCrédito offers a loan package to help families in those areas to improve their living conditions. That’s the reason that Concepción requested a loan to build a toilet.

She is a hardworking, responsible woman, who makes clothing and tablecloths, which has helped her to provide for her children.  Concepción’s plans include expanding the scope of her work, and continuing to improve her home.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nance, coconut, tamarind, pineapple, sugar, cinnamon, etc., to make artisanal jams.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 48 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for her family.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en: Mwanamkasi, a businesswoman and a mother of one school-age child, is in her early 40’s. She is married.  She supports her family by managing a beauty salon. She is at her business from 8 am to 8 pm daily, and is able to make a good profit each month. This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy salon hair products for her business. She dreams of owning a big business. She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy salon hair products

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 23 years old, married and supports a family of two children. He has been practicing farming for the last 10 years, earning KES 11,000 per month. 

Silas has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production to sell in the area for more income gain.  He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve his life and business. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 34 years old and has seven children. She is widowed and six of her children are in school.

Leonisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Leonisa requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Leonisa has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy pig feeds, vitamins & supplies

loans.name: Lisley

texts.en:
Lisley is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lisley is 28 years old and her child is in school.

Lisley has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lisley has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Lisley would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucille is 45 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Lucille has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucille requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucille has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Lucille would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 56 years old and married with five children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Luzminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Luzminda has been in this business for 5 years now.  In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and married with three children. With two of her children in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 4 years now.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam  is 44 years old. There are five people in her family. Cultivation and animal husbandry are her main income. She can cover her family’s daily cost and education from her pig raising income.  She also has daily income from gardening vegetable, and raising chickens. 

With this loan, Nam is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids.

loans.use: build a latrine

loans.name: Thuong

texts.en: Thuong is a hardworking woman who is 53 years old. She is a widow and has one child. She needs a loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is from animal husbandry, cultvation, a small business and a salary, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: build a latrine

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is in his late 50s, married and has nine children who are all in school. He runs a charcoal business and a motorbike transport (bodaboda) business. He manages his own motorbikes. He really works hard and has been running this business for five years now. Working from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, Mohamed is able to earn a good profit each month. He runs his businesses with assistance from his wife. 

Mohamed has approached Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to request business loan support. He will invest his loan to purchase for his motorbike wheels and other spare parts which are not functioning well.  Mohamed desires to expand his business by purchasing another motorbike and to be a successful father. He is so thankful to everyone who will support his business. 

Mohamed will share this loan with her loan group "ACTABLE THE BEST GROUP", which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: buy motorbike parts & wheels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 52 years old, married, and supports a family of four children. She has been practicing farming for the last 15 years, earning KES 20,000 per month. 

Jane has applied for her first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and sale for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 36 years old and married with four children. 

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from nipa roofing making.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Martes

texts.en:
Martes is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Martes is 32 years old and three of her children are in school.

Martes has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Martes has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Marivic is 37 years old and two of her children are in school.

Marivic has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marivic has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy food ingredients

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Josephine is 49 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Josephine has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy rice

loans.name: Merylou

texts.en:
Merylou is 55 years old and married with seven children.  

Merylou is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Merylou has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy livestock feed & supplies

loans.name: Claudio Edgard

texts.es:
Claudio tiene 47 años de edad y desde hace más de veinte se dedica a la caficultura, rubro que es el principal medio de ingresos económicos para su familia. Él es un productor de una pequeña comunidad de productores que se dedica a la caficultura y tiene como meta tecnificar su finca para este nuevo ciclo.

Por esto Claudio solicita financiamiento para la compra de foliares y fertilizantes que le ayuden a mejorar la nutrición de sus 7 manzanas de café cosechero y garantizar una buena cosecha en este ciclo. Gracias a la caficultura la familia de este pequeño productor puede suplir las necesidades diarias con las que cuentan, por lo que cada día trabajan por mejorar la productividad de su finca.
texts.en:
Claudio is 47 years old and has been working in coffee cultivation for more than twenty years. This sector has been the main source of income for his family. He is a farmer within a small community of farmers who work in coffee cultivation. He has the goal of introducing technology to his estate for this new cycle.

For this, Claudio is requesting funding to purchase the foliage and fertilizers that will help him to improve the health of his 7 “manzanas” [a land measurement unit equivalent to 7000 square meters or 1.740 acres] of coffee and to guarantee a good harvest in this cycle. Thanks to coffee cultivation, the family of this small farmer can meet their daily necessities. They work everyday to improve the productivity of their estate.

loans.use: to purchase the foliage and fertilizers that his coffee plantation requires.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
As a mother of one lovely angel, Caren's great desire is to see her child grow to become a professional. It is what encourages Caren and fills her with enthusiasm. 

Karen has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years. On her farm, she grows maize, has two dairy cows, and keeps poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. When she is not farming, she engages in some personal business to help supplement the income she earns. Despite her low earnings, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction. "I enjoy it most when I see customers come back for my products because it shows me that I am meeting their needs!" she says. 

Caren's biggest challenge is drought. The long dry season can lead to crop failures and poor yields. For a farmer, this means business losses and lack of food for the family. Because of this challenge, Caren formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports small rural farmers. 

Caren is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow and is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Caren is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer. All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and a good livelihood.

Caren hopes to succeed thanks to the support from the kind-hearted people that support small holder farmers.

loans.use: buy a quality dairy cow
